loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella T. rents a stall along the high street Mbarara, behind the UTL offices, where she offers typing, printing and photocopying services. Situated in a strategic place, her store has a high inflow of customers and this calls for the purchase of more equipment to ensure the demands of the customers are met. Therefore, Angella will use the loan to purchase a new photocopying and printing machine for her business. 

Angella, a mother of 5, has been in the stationery business over a period of 15 years now. She dreams of transforming her business into an all-round stationery and bookshop. With this outcome, she hopes to give her husband a hand in providing for the family and sending the children to school. She also aspires to cultivate plantains on a large scale on the plot of land she inherited from her parents.

loans.use: To purchase a new photocopying and printing machine

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon S., 57, is a farmer and raises pigs from her house in Pursat Province, which is located 200 kilometers west of Phnom Penh. She can earn around $1.50 per day. She lives with her husband and one child. Her husband is a local doctor and runs a small business selling medicine targeted at the customers who live in his area. Nuon needs a loan for her husband's business to purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine for her husband's business to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish for re-sale.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong T. is a 44 year old rice farmer. He lives in Pursat Province, west of Phnom Penh City. He has been farming rice since 1984. He is married and has five children, all of whom live in the family home. Two of the children are garment workers and three are in school. His wife is a grocery seller who sells many kinds of products in her village. 

To increase family income, Kong T. needs a loan for his wife's business to purchase more grocery inventory to sell. His wife is pictured above because Kong T. was not available in that time.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery inventory to sell.

loans.name: Khvek Chiep Group

texts.en:
There are three borrowers in this group loan. They all live in the Battambang Province. Mr. Khvek C. is 62 years old and the leader of the group. Since 2000, he makes a living by carrying a paste-fish to charge the money as a work requirement. His wife, Mrs. Chheng Vorn, is 47 years old, is a local tailor and also sells fish. She has been doing this work long time ago. She is also the mother of six children. Five of the children are in school and one daughter helps her to sell fish. C. seeks $200 loans to buy more fishes for his wife to sell. Other two are: 

Mrs. Ros H. is a 37 year old tailor and is applying for a loan $100 to purchase a sewing machine. Mrs. Ros K. is a 33 year old domestic tailor. For another source income, she is requesting a loan of $100 to buy small ducks to raise.

loans.use: to buy more fishes for his wife to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy rice for her business.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun S. is 49 years old and raises pigs from her house in the Pursat Province. She can sell pigs for slaughter within three or four months and earns around $5 per day. She is married and has four children, one of whom is married and three of whom are single. Her husband is a lifting worker who lifts everything he can to earn an income and makes around $3 per day. To help earn money for the family, one of their daughters left home to work as garment worker in Phnom Penh. 

Because of the growth of her pig raising business, S. needs a loan to purchase more piglets to raise and more wood to use to repair her house. The loan will help to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise and wood to make house repairs.

loans.name: Sarn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarn K. is the group leader of five who all live in Trapaing Pring village in Kampong Chhang Province. She owns a small grocery store in the local market. In her business, she now has a lot of customers with increasing demands. In order to meet their demands, she decided to request a loan to purchase more grocery items for them. Mrs. Sarn K. is a 44-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a farmer while the other is attending the local school.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product. This loan is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor because it allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to maK. their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client maK. their payments on tiM..

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods for her customers.

loans.name: I

texts.en:
I R. is 52 years old. She has been growing rice since 1986. She is widowed with nine children, two of whom are married.

With a large family, I R. works hard everyday to care for her children. Three of her sons help to earn income to support the family. One son runs a motorcycle repair business near his house. His business is growing, and I R. needs a loan to purchase more materials for his repair service and to buy gasoline to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to repair motocycles and gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Sabet's Group

texts.en:
Sabet L. is the group leader of five villagers from Sre Khtom in Kampong Chhang Province. He is a farmer who earns a living by cultivating rice on his small piece of land. Aside from being a farmer, he is also a photographer. His wife, Mrs. Ung Vanna, is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand her pig-breeding business.  Mr. Sabet L. then decided to request a loan for his wife to buy more piglets for breeding. He is 37 years old and a father of two children who are attending the local school.

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product. This loan is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor because it allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Three borrowers are sharing this loan. 

Mrs. Ran N., 37, who makes a living selling many different kinds of fruits in the market, has been business for sixteen years. She cares for three children, all of whom attend school. Her oldest daughter is employed as a hairdresser. Her husband, Mr. Vy Savet, age 38, is a motorcycle taxi driver. 

To expand her business, Mrs. N. is applying for a loan to buy additional fruits, including oranges and apples, to store for resale. 

Ran is the lead for two other borrowers:

Mrs. Hort P., age 55 and widowed, sells fruit in the market. She is applying for a loan to by more fruit to store and resell. 

Mrs. Vy S., 46, earns her income from selling fish. She needs a loan to purchase fishing tools for her husband’s business. They live in Battambag Province.

loans.use: To buy more fruit

loans.name: Nikolay

texts.en: Nikolai is married and has one baby daughter. He co-owns a furniture business. This is a retail business. They rent space in a store and put the furniture to be sold there. He has been in this business for two years. The business has grown rapidly because the furniture he sells is in high demand. Today, the gross income is 70,000 UAH a month; net profit is 7,000 UAH per month. Being very entrepreneurial in nature, Nikolay sees the potential for business growth. He would like to rent space in another store and open a second location. He needs a loan of 5,000 UAH. Nikolay hopes that additional income would finally allow him to purchase an apartment for his family.

loans.use: To pay rent for a second business location

loans.name: Mr. Boy Uk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people from Tuol Tbaeng village in Takeo Province have grouped themselves for a village bank loan and Mr. Boy U. is the village bank president. He is a bicycle repairman. His wife, Mrs. Heng Sothea, is a fish breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it and Mr. Boy U. decided to ask for a loan for his wife to buy fish for her  breeding business. He hopes that her business will increase their income and provide a better life for their family. He is 25 years old and a father of a child who is still too young to work or study. Mr. Boy U. did not come to take the loan, so his wife appears in the group picture in his stead.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product. This loan is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor because it allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fish for his wife's fish breeding business.

loans.name: Meach

texts.en:
Meach A. is 37 years old. She is rice farmer who also raises pigs for sale. She is married and started the business with her husband in 1979. She has three children, all of whom live in the family home. One daughter is a garment worker and two help farm rice.

To sell her pigs for slaughter on time for a high price, Meach A. needs a loan to purchase pig food to fatten her existing pigs.

loans.use: To purchase pig food to fatten her existing pigs.

loans.name: Kiswahili Cell A-Night Group

texts.en:
Night A. is a hardworking and determined businesswoman. She rents a stall on Mbaguta Street, Mbarara, at the rate of 150,000 UGX per month, in which she sells second hand clothes and offers tailoring services. From her savings as a poultry keeper, Night raised the capital to set up this business that now earns her an approximate weekly profit of 120,000 UGX.

She is using the loan funds to purchase a variety of fabrics to meet the demands of her clients. Besides her ten years' experience in this business, Night attracts her customers by being social and friendly to them. She hopes to own a unisex boutique stocked with the latest designer outfits.

Married to a businessman, and a mother of three, 40-year-old Night is also a loving guardian to her late sister’s daughter. Her children and niece attend the same primary school in Mbarara. This is her third loan and she hopes that it will help her business grow, thereby increasing the profit margins. If that happens, she will be in a position to help her husband in the construction of their residence, and with school fees for the children.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fabrics

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Mrs. Yon O., 58, is a resident of Preyngy Commune in Pursat Province. She sells groceries and ice-creams for kids, and has been doing this for a long time. She is married with five children; four who are in school, and one who is married. Her husband, Mr. Yem Norin, aged 61, is a national lottery agent who gets commission from the company to sustain his family's needs. Recently, O. sold her groceries till she had an empty store, and she would like to request a loan to refill her grocery stock for resale.

loans.use: To buy groceries for sale

loans.name: Sokleang

texts.en: Mrs. Sokleang C. is a villager in Pearaing Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small rice mill from which she derives her  income. Her husband, Mr. Chay Sopheap, is a Tuk Tuk (motorized tricycle) driver who also earns a small income to support the household. Although they have different businesses, they still cannot provide better conditions for the household. Mrs. Sokleang Chann decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sokleang Chann is 32 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To add to her saving to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married and has one daughter. They have a family business selling shoes at the market. He started this business 5 years ago with a small amount of inventory and just one location. The business turned out to be successful. Later he opened a second location, and then a third one. Today, his gross monthly income is about 10,000 UAH.

This time, Sergei would like to get a seasonal loan of 2,000 UAH with the purpose of purchasing more inventory. Sergei has a goal in his business - to open his own small store and work there together with his wife and daughter.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start selling used clothing in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To replenish a small clothing shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cloth to produce window curtains and tablecloths

loans.name: Leab

texts.en:
Mr. Leab N. is a 28-year-old who lives in Ang Doung village in Kandal Province. He is the father of a young child. Mr. N. is employed in garment factory. 

His wife, Mrs. Aul Thary, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. She does not have much money to support her field. 

Thus, Mr. Leab N. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds, pesticides, fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work on the field. He hopes to increase the income from the rice so he can support their household.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, pesticides, fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Roen

texts.en:
Mrs. Roen P. lives in Ang village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She does not have much money for planting on the land. Thus, she decided to request a loan to to plow the land, and to purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to kill insects on the filed. She hopes to increase the revenue from her rice field in order to provide a better life for her family. 

Mrs. Roen P. is a 53-year-old widow with three children, two of whom are employed in garment factory. The other childs attends the local school.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
Mrs. Suos S., age 48, is a resident Banteay Meanchey province. She operates a small grocery store in her home, where she sells items like plastic products and ingredients for cooking. She earns an income of approximately $4 per day from her business. 

She has six children; three are married and live away her home, and other three are employed. Her husband, Mr. Meas Sovan, 51, works in his wife's business. 

S. has applied a loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her family's transportation. With the rest of the money, she will by additional groceries for her store.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and add groceries to her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more firewood to resell.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en: Koffi Ewe T. is 33 years of age, married and has 2 children.  In the local language, Ewe, his first name indicates that he was born on Friday.  Koffi lives in the village of Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital.  To provide for his family, Koffi picks up passengers along the road with his motorcycle and drops them off at their destination.  This service is always in demand in Wome as there is no electricity in this village and people must often travel further than walking distance.  Koffi has asked for this loan through Kiva, so that he can buy a new motorcycle. This would allow him to provide a better service to his customers.  With the profits he will earn from his business, Koffi can continue to send his children to school and provide for his wife and family.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To raise a calf into an ox to plow their rice field.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mr. Chan M., 59, has run his business for over ten years. He makes jars, and usually sells them to wholesalers who order a few days or a week in advance. He has five children, two of whom are construction worker in Thailand, and three who are married. His wife, Mrs. Chim Phet, age 61, helps in her husband's business. 

Mr. M. would like to get a loan to purchase more raw materials to make jars to sell. The family reside in Banteay Meanchey Province.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a calf for her husband's business

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en: Mrs. Chhom P. lives in Angk village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Touch Khuon, own land and cultivate rice with a lot of hard work to earn money. They do not have much money to support their farm. Thus, Mrs. Chhom P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on their field. She is 55 years old and the mother of five children. Two of her children are employed in garment factory, another is a farmer, and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on her field

loans.name: Adjovi Apéafa

texts.fr:
Madame D. Adjovi Apéafa est née le 15 juin 1987 à Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Cette jeune fille qui a vingt-et-un ans est très motivée et elle a sa propre entreprise à ce jeune âge.  Elle est célibataire, et elle n’a pas d’enfant.  Elle a pour l’activité le vente des produits d’alimentation et n’a jamais bénéficié d’un prêt au près de WAGES.  

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’achète 10 sacs de riz, 10 bidons d’huile, 10 cartons de macaroni, et 6 cartons de tomates.  Avec ce nouveau stock, elle peut bien vendre et servir ses clients pendant les périodes de fête à la fin d’année.
texts.en:
Miss Adjovi Apéafa D. was born on June 15, 1987 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. This young woman, 21, is very motivated and she has her own business at this young age. She is single and she has no children. Her business is selling foodstuffs and she has never had a loan from WAGES.

This first loan that she is requesting will permit her to buy 10 sacks of rice, 10 jerry cans of oil, 10 cases of macaroni, and 6 cases of tomato paste. With this new stock, she will be able to make a lot of sales and serve her customers during the end-of-year festivities.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Oreb Group

texts.en:
Felly sells seeds and also does farming. He started his business in 1999. With hard work and good management, Felly prospered in his business until 2007 when a torrential rain flooded the Tshwenge stream nearby.The flood overwhelmed his field, destroying all the crops.

Most of his business goods were also destroyed in the flood. He continued just selling seeds until January 2008, when he realized that the income from selling seeds was not sufficient to support his family. After Felly joined one of Hope’s groups named Oreb last February, he reinforced his seed business and began cultivating his field again.

With his next loan, Felly plans to open a fertilizer and pesticide store for many farmers in his area. Felly is married and has four children. In addition to his children, he also takes care of his niece.

loans.use: To open a fertilizer and pesticide store for the many farmers in his area

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun P. lives in Lvea Sor Kandal village in Kandal Province. She sells cabbage in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Chea Phong, is a construction worker. Even though they have different businesses, they still earn less income than they need to provide a better life for their family. 

Thus, Mrs. Aun P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income after she sells her cow. 

She is 36 years old and the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband appears on her right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mrs. Suy S., age 58, is a widow who makes a living by raising pigs and by selling a little rice and food. This is the main source of income for her family. She has three children. All are married, and one of her daughters is a local tailor who earns an income of $4 per day. They live together in Banteay Meanchey Province. 

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle to make the family's transportation easier, to buy a piglet to raise, and to purchase a sewing machine for her daughter's business.

Mrs. S. was not available, so her daughter is presented in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria A. is 33 years old and the married mother of 3 children.  Two of her children are in school and her youngest, shown here, goes to work with her everyday. To provide for her family, Gloria sells a variety of medications in her village.  She lives in Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital.  She carries the two baskets pictured here on her head and walks throughout the village market selling her products.  Gloria hopes to use this loan from Kiva to travel to the capital and restock her inventory, as more medications are now becoming available in Lomé.  Gloria contributes to the medical needs of her community and with the profits that she will earn from her business, she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To restock her inventory

loans.name: Vit

texts.en:
Mr. Vith Mak is a villager in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Mak Sokoeun, breeds ducks. Although they have different businesses, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. 

In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Vith Mak has decided to ask for a loan to buy a machine for threshing rice, which he will rent to other villagers to earn an income. He is 39 years old and the father of three children, one of whom attends the local school. The others are too young.

Mr. Mak's wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy a machine for threshing rice to rent to the villagers for income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mr. Kong B. is a villager in Hang Heng village in Takeo Province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Phuong Kunthea, is employed in a garment factory. Since their workplaces are far from their house, they usually pay a lot of money for motorbike taxi transport. 

Thus, Mr. Kong B. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to travel to work in order to reduce his expenses. He is 26 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. His wife and daughter are shown with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to travel to work

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny P. is a farmer in Lvea Sor Kandal village in Kandal Province. She owns a piece of land on which she cultivates vegetables to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Yin Yath, is a motorbike taxi driver. Even though they have different careers, they still earn less income than they need to provide a better life for their household. 

In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Ny P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy timber, steel, and zinc to build a house for her family, so they can live in better conditions. 

She is 36 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom attend the local school; the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is also presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy timber, steel, and zinc to build a house.

loans.name: Bagnidoma Yawa

texts.fr:
Madame B. Bagnidoma Yawa est née le 1 septembre 1977 à Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Elle est célibataire est elle n’a pas d’enfant, donc elle peut utiliser les profits de son entreprise pour subvenir à ses charges et celles de sa famille.  Elle a pour activité le vente des pagnes, sacs et chaussures, et elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un prêt au près de WAGES.  

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’acheter 30 pièces de Phoénix Pagnes, 10 sacs, et 20 chaussures.  Ces types de marchandises sont  très utiles pour les cadeaux pendant les périodes de fête à la fin d’année, donc la demande a actuellement augmentée.  Avec ce nouveau stock, elle peut bien vendre et servir ses clients.
texts.en:
Miss Bagnidoma Yawa B. was born on September 1, 1977 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is single and has no children, so she is able to use her earnings to support herself and help her family. Her business is selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African cloth used for clothing, turbans, and to strap a baby on your back), handbags, and shoes, and she has never received a loan from WAGES.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 30 lengths of Phoénix-brand "pagnes", 10 handbags, and 20 pairs of shoes. This sort of merchandise is very useful as presents during the end-of-year festivities so the demand has grown. With this new stock she will be able to make a lot of sales and fill her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes", handbags, and shoes

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguon S., 43, is a Commune Committee Adviser who currently gets a salary of $100 a month. She lives in Banteay Meanchey Province. She is married with four children, one of whom is employed as a dealer for a casino near the border between Thailand and Cambodia. 

Her husband, age 46, is a motorcycle taxi driver who currently earns around $5 a day. Mrs. S. needs a loan to replace her husband's motorcycle, which is so old that it does often not attract customers.

Mrs. S.'s husband appears in  the picture, because she was not available.

loans.use: To replace an old motorcycle

loans.name: Eyana

texts.fr:
Madame T. Eyana est née en 1960 à Tchitchao, dans la préfecture de Kozah.  Elle est veuve, et elle a trois enfants qu’elle doit soutenir elle-même.  À ce but, elle a ouvert un magasin depuis 1993 qui s’appelle Couture Amour De Dieu, où elle vend les boubous et les habits pour les enfants.  Son magasin est situé à Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  

Elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES.  Elle fabrique les vêtements elle-même, et avec ce premier crédit, elle peut acheter 12 rouleaux de tissus pour la confection des habits.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eyana T. was born in 1960 in Tchitchao, the department of Kozah. She is a widow and has three children she must provide for on her own. With this goal in mind, she opened a store in 1993 named "Couture Amour De Dieu". She sells boubous (traditional African garments) and children' s clothing. Her store is located in Agoè, a neighborhood north of Lomé, Togo's capital.

She has never received a loan from WAGES. She sews the clothes herself, and with this first loan she could buy 12 bolts of fabric to make clothing.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric for clothing

loans.name: Yawo

texts.en:
Yawo A. is 47 years old and a married father. Yawo lives and works in the village of Wome, approximately 130 kilometers from the capital of Togo, Lomé. He has operated a flour production business for many years to support his large family and grandchildren. The business has been very successful and he now has several employees. Yawo buys corn from nearby markets and uses the machine in the photo to grind it into flour which he then resells. This flour is always in demand to make a popular Togolese dish called La Pate.

With this loan from FECECAV, Yawo hopes to buy another grinder that would double his flour production. The price of corn has risen sharply in recent months, so he will also use some of this loan to support his corn purchases. Yawo appreciates this opportunity from Kiva to both expand his business and provide for his family.

loans.use: Purchase a second flour grinding machine

loans.name: Kossiwavi Akpéné

texts.fr:
Madame T. Kossiwavi Akpéné est une femme Togolaise qui est née le 18 juin 1961 à Lomé, la capitale du pays.  Elle est mariée avec un homme qui est militaire retraité, et ils ont trois enfants.  Depuis 2000, elle a vendu des produits génériques, sacs, et chaussures à Agoè, un quartier au nord de la ville.  

Elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un prêt au près de WAGES.  Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’acheter 6 cartons de produits génériques, 50 sacs, et 100 chaussures.  Ces types de marchandises sont  très populaires pour les cadeaux pendant les périodes de fête à la fin d’année, donc la demande est actuellement augmentée.  Avec ce nouveau stock, elle peut bien vendre et servir ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kossiwavi Akpéné T. is a Togolese woman who was born on June 18, 1961 in Lomé, the capital of the country. She is married to a man who is retired military, and they have 3 children. Since 2000 she has been selling generic products, handbags, and shoes in Agoè, a neighborhood north of the city.

She has never received a loan from WAGES. This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 6 cases of generic products, 50 handbags and 100 pairs of shoes. This sort of merchandise is very popular as presents during the end-of-year festivities so the demand for these things is greater at present. With this new stock, she will be able to make more sales and serve her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of generic products, handbags, and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Pashakul

texts.en:
Pashakul A. is an older man with lots of experience. He is married with 4 children. He is uneducated and he works in agriculture and has been involved in this business for more than 7 years, working with his family during this time. He is a professional farmer and, from back when he started his business, he has always wanted to improve his business.

In the town where he lives, when any of the agricultural men face any difficulties, they come and ask IMON to help with their problems. Therefore, today Pashakul is applying to Kiva hoping for your help. He is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni (300 USD) for the term of 8 months to buy some seed and fertilizer for his land. He is grateful for this loan process.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Yunusjon

texts.en:
Yunusjon M. is a farmer and has been working the land during the past 4 years. There are 7 people in his family, including his wife, 3 children and 2 parents, all of whom are his responsibility. Educated through secondary school, he farms as his principal business activity, something he had formal training in. And it has done the trick for him financially.

In the picture you can see his wife, as Yunusjon himself wasn’t at his home the day of our visit. Due to the upcoming season he needs to grow wheat, onions, and corn. This requires money and he does not have enough. And so he is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for the term of 8 months to stock up on seeds and fertilizer for a successful harvest. The income will allow him to take better care of his children's health, nourishment, and schooling.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Gulinor

texts.en:
Gulinor P. is 60 years old. She’s a widow and has 3 children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work when her husband passed away. For about 7 years together with her son, who is pictured on the photo, she has been purchasing calves in the local market, fattening and selling them.

Gulinor is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family and educate her children, who today are working adults thanks to her example. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. Gulinor wakes up early every morning to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. Now she is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni (300 USD) with a term of 5 months to buy calves in order to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand her business

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.en:
Tojiniso S. describes herself as a hard-working, enterprising and happily married mother of 4 children. Her husband is a laborer. She decided to start a tailoring business to help him with household expenses, since she wanted her children to get an education and that wasn't possible on her husband's salary alone.

Tojiniso started out helping a woman who ran a tailoring shop, and after she had learned the trade well, she installed a small shop in her home. It has gone very well since then, and she has been able to grow the business over a period of 10 years. Now her daughters are grown and they help Tojiniso with her business.

Now Tojiniso is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni (300 USD) for the term of 5 months, which she will use to purchase an extra tailoring machine so she can fulfill her customers' requests. Tojiniso and her family are very grateful for your support in helping her grow this business and move ahead.

loans.use: purchasing a tailoring machine

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith A. is 42 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband is a civil servant. All their children are in secondary school. Edith sells second hand clothes.The demand for her second hand clothes is high. Edith is requesting  the loan amount of $1200 to purchase more second hand clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita Omordion is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She sells household items like pots, plates, spoons, etc. she has many customers who patronize her business. She hopes to expand her business by increasing her stock. Rita is requesting  the loan amount of $700 to purchase more household items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more house hold items to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac O. is 29 years old and he is single. He sells motor spare parts in a motor spare parts market. He sells daily from 7am - 7:30pm. He is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell and he hopes to expand his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Essoyo-Mewe

texts.fr:
Madame B. esso-mewe est née le 31 décembre 1968 à tchitchao dans la préfecture de la Kozah au nord du Togo. Elle habite dans le quartier d’Agoe sogbossito, elle divorcée de son mari EGBAME Komlan qui est technicien en génie civil et ont six enfants (06). Elle est revendeuse de boissons et s’approvisionne à lomé. Elle a un bar dans le quartier d’Agoè assiyéyé.  Madame B. a déjà obtenu un crédit de 300000F chez WAGES qu’elle a remboursé sans contraintes.
Avec l’expérience dans son commerce qu’elle  exerce depuis 1999 et la gestion du crédit, elle sollicite un deuxième crédit d’un montant de 500000F pour agrandir son stock qui est fini avec soixante dix casiers (70) de bières et vingt neuf (29) casiers de sucrerie.
texts.en:
Mrs, Essoyo-Mewe B. was born on December 31, 1968 in Tchitchao in the prefecture of Kozah in the north of Togo. She lives in the neighborhood of Agoè Sogbossito. She is divorced from her husband Komlan Egbame, a technician; they have 6 children. She sells drinks and does her buying in Lomé. She has a bar in the neighborhood of Agoè Assiyéyé. Mrs. B. has already had a loan of 300,000 F from WAGES and reimbursed it correctly.

With the experience from her business which she has been in since 1999, and having managed the previous loan, she is requesting a second loan in the amount of 500,000 F to expand her stock, which is presently expended, with 70 crates of beer and 29 cases of sweet drinks.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of drinks

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia E. is 61 years old and married with 5 children. She sells sarongs, slippers, children clothes, local pots, jewellery, and rubber sandals. Her husband is a plumber. She has no store but she hawks her goods from street to street in her community. She is requesting the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs, rubber sandals and jewellery to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, rubber sandals and jewellery to sell

loans.name: Diénaba

texts.fr: DiénaB. B., 36 ans, mariée, 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Plateau 2 depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut  renforcer ses activités de restauration au niveau du marché hebdomadaire et de vente de sucre et d’huile. L’activité de restauration est menée les jours de marché de la localité. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
DiénaB. B., 36, married and raising 7 children, has been a member of the Village Bank of Plateau 2 for a year and a half. She wants to bolster her food service business (at the weekly market) as well as her sales of sugar and oil. The food served takes place on the market days in that locality.

Her income allows her to help support her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months, in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sugar, oil, and condiments

loans.name: Dolibe

texts.fr:
Madame TAYEE est née le 18 avril 1952 à bassar, une ville au centre du Togo. Elle est divorcée de son mari BOTCHI Philipe et à trois (03) enfants à charge. Elle fait le commerce de chaussures qu’elle va acheter au grand marché de Lomé pour venir revendre à ses clients. Elle  a déjà obtenu un crédit de 500000F qu’elle a bien et régulièrement remboursé.
Elle demande un autre prêt  pour varier son commerce et tirer des bénéfices pour s’occuper correctement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. was born April 18, 1952, in Bassar, a city in the middle of Togo. She is divorced from her husband, Philipe Botchi, and has three children to care for. She sells shoes which buys at the big market in Lomé and brings back to sell to her customers. She has already gotten a loan of 500,000 CFA francs which she fully paid back in regular installments. She seeks another loan to diversify her business whose profits she will use to properly take care of her family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr: Salimata D., 36 ans, mariée avec 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Bidiankoto depuis 1 an. Elle veut  renforcer ses activités de ventes de tissus teintés (imprimé et en couleur unique). Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Salimata D., age 36, is married and has seven children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group Vélingara Bidiankoto for a year. She wants to bolster her business selling dyed cloth (print fabrics and solid colors). The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell dyed fabrics

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en:
Ronke sells drinks, foodstuffs and provisions. She has been in this business for a long time. Ronke is 40 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is an automobile mechanic.

She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 41-year-old married man with four children, living in Tyr, Southern Lebanon. Hassan is a dedicated construction worker who works on very small projects. In order to expand his business, Hassan wants to borrow US$ 1,000 to buy scaffolding in order to be able to take on larger projects and therefore better support his family.

loans.use: Buy scaffolding for his business

loans.name: Musarat M.tahir Baig Group

texts.en:
My name is Musarat and I reside in Lahore, Pakistan. I have been living in this city for the past 14 years. I completed my education until the 8th standard and couldn’t study further because of my father’s low income. My husband's name is M. B. who has a decorative embroidery business. My husband has been teaching me the skill and art of embroidery and I am involved in the business. We both handle taking orders from the market. I have five sons. My elder son has a utensils selling business. The others are enrolled in a local school in the neighborhood. I have repaid my three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am requesting a loan to buy materials (colored threads and beads) needed to expand our decorative embroidery business.

I am a group leader of a few more members of my locality. Najma baji is requesting a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Zaitoon baji is requesting a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. Parveen baji is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Maqbool baji is requesting a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the repayment of the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy material for her decorative embroidery business.

loans.name: Khalida M.maqbool Group

texts.en:
Khalida baji is a 20 year old married woman and resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 10 years. Her husband, M., is a wood seller by profession. He has been selling wood for the past 10 years. Khalida baji has one daughter who reads in 3rd standard. Khalida baji completed her education until the 10th standard and she now runs an education center in her house where she teaches the children of her community. She earns Pak rupees 3,000 per month and shares her income with her husband so that they are able to meet the expenses of her house and the education needs of her daughter. She has successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy more woods to expand her husband’s wood selling business.

Khalida baji is a group leader of a few more members in her locality. Saima baji is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Nawab baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Kaneez Fatima baji is requesting a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment of the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy wood for resale.

loans.name: Rubina Ashiq Maish Group

texts.en:
My name is Rubina and I have lived in Lahore Pakistan for the past 25 years. My husband name is A. M., who has owned a scrap business for the past 18 years. I have five children: three sons and two daughters. I make embroidered dresses and sell each dress for $2. I complete approximately 10 embroidered dresses per month and earn $20. I successfully repaid my four loans which I borrowed from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). I am now requesting my fifth loan to buy iron and plastic bottles for my husband’s scrap business.

I am a group leader with a few more women in my locality. Rabia baji is requesting a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe making business. Asia baji is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Parveen baji is requesting a loan to repair their cycles for her rented cycle business. Shabana baji is requesting a loan to buy glass for her glass selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment of the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy scrap for her husband's business.

loans.name: Mumtaz Barkat Ali Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz baji is a 41 year old married woman and resides in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband, B. A., is a painter by profession and sells paints as well. Mumtaz baji is the mother of three sons. For the past 20 years, Mumtaz baji has been a seamstress and sews clothes by taking orders from her neighborhood. She is is requesting a loan to buy paint brushes and paints to expand her family business.

She is a group leader of a few more members of her locality. Majeedan baji is requesting a loan to buy wheels for vehicles to resell. Nasreen baji is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Parveen baji is requesting a loan to pay the installments of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Hamidan baji is requesting a loan to buy repairing tools for her mobile phone repairing business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment of the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy paint brushes and paints.

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en: Lovely O. sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 31 years old and married with 4 children. She buys her goods from the market in her community and the drinks from a distributor. She is happy with her business. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing I. sells provisions like bathing soaps, detergent, etc. She is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy E. is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions to her customers. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Yéma

texts.fr:
Madame T. Yéma est née le 31 décembre 1986 à Bafilo, une localité situé au centre du Togo. Elle est divorcée de son époux Mr KASSIM Guyazou, elle a un (01) enfant et ils habitent tous deux dans le quartier d’Agoè Cacavéli. Madame T. Yéma est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et va revendre son stock en détail à Agoè Cacvéli.
Elle sollicite un premier crédit avec lequel elle va acheter 4 sacs de riz, 3 bidons d’huile, 4 cartons de savons, 2 cartons de lait, 10 cartons de spaghettis et 1 carton de biscuits.
texts.en:
Ms. Yéma T. was born on December 31, 1986 in Bafilo, a town located in central Togo. She is divorced from her spouse Mr. Guyazou KASSIM. She has one child, and they both live in the Agoè Cacavéli district. She is a retailer of grocery items. Her supplies come from the grand marketplace of Lomé and are going to be resold retail in Agoè Cacavéli. She is requesting an initial loan with which she is going to buy four sacks of rice, 3 drums of oil, 4 boxes of soap, 2 boxes of milk, 10 boxes of spaghetti, and 1 box of cookies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes O. sells bags of garri in wholesale and retail. She travels to the village to purchase bags of garri to sell in Benin City. Agnes is a widow with 6 children. She is 45 years old. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags garri to sell

loans.name: Sunny

texts.en: Sunny E. sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, garri, etc. He started this business in 2006. He is 42 years old and married with 3 children. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. He says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Monsieur G. Koffi est né à atchanvé dans la préfecture de Zio. Il est divorcé de sa femme ANGLO Adjo avec laquelle il a eu un (01) enfant, il habite dans le quartier d’Agoè Kitidjan. Il fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale et s’approvisionne au marché d’Agoè Atchanvé pour revendre son stock en détail à ses clients d’Agoè Atchanvé.
Monsieur G. n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES, il demande un prêt pour pouvoir satisfaire la demande augmentée surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année. Avec ce prêt il va acheter 20 sacs de riz GINO, 4 bidons d’huile et 9 paquets de sucre.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi G., born in Atchanvé in Zio Prefecture, is divorced from his wife Adjo ANGLO with whom he had one child. He lives in the Agoè Kitidjan district and does commerce in grocery items. His supplies come from the Agoè Atchanvé marketplace and are sold retail to customers of that area. Having never been the recipient of a WAGES loan, he is requesting a loan to satisfy the increased demand, especially during this year-end holiday season. With this loan, he is going to buy 20 sacks of GINO rice, 4 drums of oil, and 9 packets of sugar.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in food items

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina O. sells second hand clothes. She travels to Lagos and Onitsha to purchase second hand clothes to sell to her customers. Justina hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more second hand clothes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris O. sells foodstuffs like yams, plantain, melon seed, peppers, tomato paste, etc. She hopes to expand her foodstuff business. She is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn O. sells provisions in her shop. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Assana

texts.fr:
Madame I. Assana est née en 1967 à parakou au BENIN, un pays voisin du Togo. Elle habite le quartier d’Agoè kitigan à Lomé (Togo), elle a deux (02) enfants et est divorcé de son mari OUSSENI Salifou qui est un chauffeur. I. Assana est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1996. Elle est est très dynamique et très motivée dans son commerce pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle a déjà obtenu un crédit de 500000F auprès de WAGES qu’elle a remboursée sans difficultés.
Elle demande un autre crédit pour s’approvisionner avec 15 sacs de riz et 12 bidons d’huile.
texts.en:
Ms. Assana I. was born in 1967 in Parakou, Benin, a country neighboring Togo. She lives in the Agoè Kitigan district in Lomé (Togo), has two children, and is divorced from her husband Salifou OUSSENI, a chauffeur. She is a retailer of grocery items and has been in this business since 1996. She is very energetic and highly motived in her work in order to support her family. Having already been a recipient of a 500,000 franc loan from WAGES that she repaid without difficulty, she is asking for another loan to get supplies: 15 sacks of rice and 12 drums of oil.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing F. sells fufu. Fufu is gotten from fermented cassava. She purchases cassava from farmers to process into fufu. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more cassava to process into fufu to sell. She is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to process into fufu

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en: Augusta O. is 44 years old and married with 5 children. Augusta sells woods to people building houses. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more woods to sell to her customers. She says thanks to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more woods to sell

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans I. owns a video shop where he rents video CD’s and sells rechargeable phone cards to his customers; however, he makes more profit from the sale of rechargeable phone cards. He needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. He is 32 years old and married with a child. He says thank you to all that make this loan possible

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ligia B. G. tiene la edad de 39 años,  habita en el reparto Juan Ramón junto a su esposo y hijos. El esposo de la señora trabaja en transporte  para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. Esta señora trabaja como domestica en una casa particular y es un trabajo cansado,  y tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar ya que sus hijos estudian. Con sus propios esfuerzos y el apoyo de nuestra institución ha logrado mantener el negocio. Con esta solicitud del préstamo  es para incrementar su inventario ya que estamos en temporada navideña y las ventas son buenas, también poder ofertar sus productos variados a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ligia B. G. is 39 years old and lives in Juan Ramón together with her husband and children. Her husband works in transportation in order to help with the household expenses. The plans for the future include improving the standard of living of her children. This lady works as a housekeeper at someone's house, which is tiring work, and she also has a small business selling clothing to help the family financially since the children are in school. Through her own efforts, and the support of our institution, she has managed to maintain the business. With this loan request, she hopes to increase her inventory to take advantage of the holiday season which is traditionally a time when sales are brisk. In addition, she would like to offer a wider variety of products to her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for the holiday season.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel O. sells building materials. She sells in Evbotubu Market in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Ruth De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Ruth de Jesús Dávila, tiene la edad de 24 años,  habita en el borgoña ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como jardinero en una casa privada para poder ayudarle con los gastos de la casa, ya que tiene a su cargo a la mamá, ellos todavía no tienen hijos. Los planes hacia un futuro es llegar a establecer el negocio ya que ella trabaja vendiendo ropa en los departamentos de nuestro país. Ella solicita es préstamo para comprar mas ropa y obtener ganancia ya que este mes de Diciembre las ventas son buenas y quiere logra vender en esta temporada para obtener buenas ganancias
texts.en:
Ruth de Jesús Dávila is 24 years old and lives in the Ticuantepe municipality. Her husband works as a gardener at a private home in order to help with the household expenses. As she cares for her mother, they still do not have any children. Her plans for the future are to establish a business, as she sells clothing throughout various areas of our country. She requests this loan to buy clothes so she has more merchandise to sell during this month of December when sales are brisk. She wants to sell a great deal during the holiday season to bring in a good amount of income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothing for adults and children.

loans.name: Tessy

texts.en: Tessy sells clothes. She is 28 years old and married with one child. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist. The demand for her clothes will increase during this festive season. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Amor y Esperanza (“Love and Hope”) Village Bank. Juana is 49 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children. 

Juana has a stand at the Grau Market, where she sells meat. She travels to regional markets twice per week to buy cows, which she then takes to the city slaughterhouse. Juana also sells homemade ice cream, which she makes with milk, sesame seeds and sugar. 

Juana needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy meat, sugar and sesame seeds. Juana’s dreams are for her children to graduate with professional degrees, to expand her business, and to finish building her house.

loans.use: Buy meat, sesame seeds and sugar

loans.name: Encarnación

texts.en:
Encarnación is a member of the Amor y Esperanza (“Love and Hope”) Village Bank. Encarnación is 45 years old and married with six children. 

Encarnación has a stand in the Las Americas Market where she sells meat twice a week. On other days she travels to regional markets to buy animals, grains and cheeses to resell in city markets. 

Encarnación needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy grains and animals. Her dreams are to educate her children, to have more investment capital and to have everything she needs in her home.

loans.use: Buy animals and grains to resell

loans.name: Mujeres De La Fe Group

texts.en:
Rosa B. is hoping to receive her second loan. She came to Esperanza International around 6 months ago with no job and was having a difficult time providing for her only child. She comes from a very poor city in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.

After receiving her first loan, she started a small stand selling various types of candy and other small items. With this next loan she hopes to expand her business and sell a more varied selection of goods. Her goal is to one day have her own grocery store. She said that she has never been more happy than she is right now. She has finally found a way to have a steady income, and she also found something was all hers.

Rosa wakes up every day excited to go to her business and excited to try and improve what she has. She said she can finally provide for her child and wants to send him to a college someday. She feels like this next loan is just going to help her expand even more, and she is so excited about this opportunity!

loans.use: Buying products for her small store

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is a member of the Amor y Esperanza (“Love and Hope”) Village Bank. She is 38 years old and married with one child. 

Dionisia grows potatoes and wheat on her small farm in Chiara. She sells her crops in the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho. Dionisia and her husband also own a tractor, so their neighbors hire them to plow their farms. Dionisia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy potatoes to plant and to pay her farmhands.

Dionisia’s dreams are for her children to get a good education, to improve her business, and to continue growing crops.

loans.use: Buy potatoes to plant, pay farmhands

loans.name: Ana Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the Amor y Esperanza (“Love and Hope”) Village Bank. She sells traditional ice cream from the Muyuchi region, which is maD. with milk, sugar and sesame seeds. She also sells a variety of chichas (traditional homemaD. wines) maD. from corn, peanuts and other fruits in the city's central market.

Nieves needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy sugar, sesame seeds and peanuts.

Nieves’s dreams are to save up for old age, for her children to graduate with professional degrees, and to have her own investment capital.

loans.use: Buy sugar, sesame seeds and peanuts

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice E. sells foodstuffs and provisions. Beatrice is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She is 56 years old and married with 8 children. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen A. is a tailor. She sews various designs for her customers. She also sells tailoring materials. Helen is married to a carpenter and they have 5 children. She is 50 years old. The demands are high for her tailoring materials, such as thread, zips, tailor chalk, and needles. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. Helen says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco Javier L. tiene la edad de 33 años, habita en el reparto Juan  Ramón Padilla, el desde hace cinco año trabaja como comerciante de frutas y verduras, es soltero el habita junto a su mamá y hermanos el cual con el esfuerzo de su mamá y hermanos han logrado establecer un poco su negocio. Los planes hacia un futuro es lograr mejorar las condiciones de su negocio. Con este préstamo va invertir en comprar productos varios para su negocio y así ofertar a sus clientes las mejores verduras.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier L. is 33 years old and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla division. For the past five years, he has worked selling fruits and vegetables. He is single and lives with his mother and brothers and, with their help and efforts, he has managed to establish his business a little. His plans for the future include making improvements to his enterprise’s condition. With this loan, he will invest in the purchase of various products for his business and that way be able to offer his customers better quality merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables in bulk quantities.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer E. sells foodstuffs and fruits like oranges, pawpaws, and apples. She is 35 years old and married with a child. Jennifer hopes to expand her fruit business. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more fruits to sell. She says a big thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Yuli Miriam

texts.en:
Yuli is a member of the Morenita Huamanga Village Bank. She is 27 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their child. 

Yuli has a chicken restaurant on the Valdelirios pedestrian street, where her specialties are hamburgers and roasted chicken. She works at the restaurant every night of the week, and sells a variety of drinks during the day. Yuli also sells cosmetics by catalog.  

Yuli needs a loan of 600 soles to buy soda and beer.

Yuli’s dreams are to buy a plot of land to build her house on and to help her family get ahead in life.

loans.use: Buy soda and beer to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase of women's clothing and accessories for a small business.

loans.name: Paz Y Amor Group

texts.en:
Rosa A. is a part of a large group of women named "Paz y Amor" which means Peace and Love. She and her whole group are living in extreme poverty, and almost all of them have no form of steady income.

Rosa is a mother to 3 children, and has to take care of them all by herself without a husband. She is so excited about the idea of starting her own business, and needs this to help provide for her 3 children. She plans on starting a small business selling fruits and vegetables in her area.

She hopes to have a thriving grocery store someday, and to save enough to send her children to college. She said she wants nothing more than for her children to have a better life than she has had, and said she is willing to do anything to give that to them. She said she feels that having her own business is the first step to reaching her goals, and she is ready for this challenge!

loans.use: Purchasing products for her business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a member of the Morenita Huamanga Village Bank. Adelaida is 75 years old and married with six children. Adelaida sells Biolife natural remedies, which prevent and treat various medical ailments. She sells her products to friends, family members and neighbors by catalog and on credit. Adelaida needs a loan of 600 soles to buy more natural remedies to sell. Adelaida’s dreams are to improve her home and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Adelaida es del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga. Adelaida es casada, tiene 75 años y 6 hijos, Adelaida vende productos naturales llamado Biolife para el tratamiento y prevención de enfermedades, ofrece a amigos familiares, vecinos, ofrece a través de catálogos, sus ventas en gran parte son al crédito. Adelaida necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos naturales. Los sueños de Adelaida son mejorar su casa y negocios.

loans.use: Buy natural remedies

loans.name: Augusta Daniela

texts.en:
Augusta is a member of the Tu Angel Lucy (“Your Angel Lucy”, named for FINCA founder Lucinda Lanao) Village Bank. Augusta lives with her partner and their daughter. Augusta bakes traditional kinds of bread in a rented oven. She sells her goods in the Ayacuchan jungle. Augusta wants to start selling toys for the Christmas season, which she will travel to Lima to buy. Augusta needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy toys and clothing. Augusta dreams of buying a plot of land to build a home of her own and of opening a store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow.

Augusta es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy. Augusta es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hija, Augusta elabora panes típicos, actividad que realiza en un horno alquilado, además vende carne, queso, estos productos lo lleva a la selva Ayacuchana. Augusta tiene proyectado vender juguetes aprovechando la fiesta navideña, para lo cual viajara a Lima. Augusta necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de juguetes y ropa. Augusta sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casa y tener una tienda.

loans.use: To buy toys and clothing for Christmas season

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a member of the Tu Angel Lucy (“Your Angel Lucy”) Village Bank, named for FINCA founder Lucinda Lanao. Florencia is 44 years old and separated with five children. Florencia sells food at different construction sites. She and her son also sell sweets at a kiosk outsiD. of Ayacucho’s national university. Florencia needs a loan of 600 soles to buy sacks of sugar and rice. Florencia’s dreams are to send her children to school and to expand her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow.

Florencia es del Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy. Florencia es separada, tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, Florencia venD. comida, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes obras D. construcción, a donD. lleva la comida. Además Florencia venD. golosinas en un kiosco ubicado en la universidad nacional D. la ciudad, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hijo. Florencia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azucar, arroz por sacos. Florencia sueña con educar a sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and sugar

loans.name: Marcial Ignacia

texts.es: El señor Marcial Ignacio González,  tiene la edad de 52 años habita en el barrio Los Madrigales ubicado en el kilómetro quince carretera hacia Ticuantepe  , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como asistente en un buffet de abogados para poder ayudarle con los gastos del hogar , , los planes hacia un futuro es logra construir su propia vivienda ya que ellos viven en la casa de la mamá de don Marcial , este señor desde hace Diez años trabaja como agricultor ya que su papá siempre lo ha apoyado . El con este préstamo va invertir en compra de insumos y aplicárselo a la producción para obtener mejor producción y así vender a un muy buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcial Ignacio G. is 52 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Los Madrigales, located in the 15th kilometer on the highway toward Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife, who works as an assistant at a lawyer’s office in order to help with the household bills. Their plan for the future is to construct their own house, since they now live in Mr. Marcial’s mother’s house. For the past 10 years, he has worked in agriculture like his father had. With the loan he receives, he will invest in supplies and will apply himself in order to obtain a better production, which will sell at a very good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Christina Stoddard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies like fertilizer for his crop

loans.name: Tuwisana Group

texts.en:
Celestin delivers and sells plastic bags and wrapping papers for food items. He began his business in 1989 after the company where he used to work closed due to political and economic instability. He now goes to different areas of the city on a regular basis to deliver goods to his clients. Celestin sells his products at a good price. By providing good customer service, Celestin has permanent customers to keep up his business.

Celestin’s business has been successful in delivering and selling wrapping papers and plastic bags. He is planning to rent a larger place in order to sell wrapping papers and plastic bags in bulk. Many people like Celestin because he keeps good relations with them and provides for their needs on time. He has been a member of Tuwisana, one of HOPE’s loan groups, since last May.

Celestin is 58 years old. He is married and has eight children. His business is located in Ngaliema, in the Western mountainous area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To rent a larger place in order to sell wrapping papers and plastic bags in bulk

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mayra Senaida

texts.en:
Mayra is a member of the Tu Angel Lucy (“Your Angel Lucy”) Village Bank, named for FINCA founder Lucinda Lanao. Mayra is 24 years old and separated with one child. Mayra sells clothing by special order. Her clients are her friends, neighbors, family members and acquaintances; she sells on credit and collects payments weekly. Mayra also travels to regional fairs, where she buys grains, which she brings to the markets of the city of Ayacucho to sell. Mayra needs a loan of 1400 soles to buy sweaters and pants. Mayra’s dreams are to build her own home and to buy a car to transport her wares.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow.

Mayra es del Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy. Mayra es separada, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Mayra vende ropa variada de acuerdo a pedidos de sus clientes, sus ventas los realiza a vecinos, amigos, familiares y conocidos, sus ventas son al crédito y cobra semanalmente. Además Mayra viaja a las ferias en donde compra cereales y luego lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Mayra necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, pantalones. Los sueños de Mayra son construir su casa, comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.

loans.use: Buy sweaters and pants

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino is a member of the Huascahura Village Bank. Faustino is 62 years old and married with seven children. Faustino buys horses in different regional villages. He travels for 10 to 15 days at a time until he has acquired enough horses, which he then brings to the city of Huancayo to sell. Faustino needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy more horses. Faustino’s dreams are for his children to go to school, to build his own home, and to progress with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Faustino es socio del Banco Comunal Huascahura. Faustino es casado, tiene 62 años y 7 hijos, Faustino se dedica a la compra de ganado equino que compra de los diferentes pueblos de la región, Faustino viaja durante 10 a 15 días hasta reunión la cantidad suficiente de ganado, luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Huancayo en donde lo comercializa.

Faustino necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado equino. Los sueños de Faustino son que sus hijos estudien, construir su casa y progresar en su negocio.

loans.use: Buy horses for re-sale

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza #5 Group

texts.en:
Tita C. came to Esperanza International in need of help. She is a very hard-working mother to 5 children, but is having a tough time taking care of and providing for all her children. She and her husband work as hard as they can, but feeding 5 children in the poverty that they live in is not a easy task.

Tita took the first loan she received and started a very small restaurant outside of her house. She is a good cook and experienced a little bit of success. She was able to make all her loan payments and also save some money. For the first time in her life, she felt successful, and felt like she could do this.

Tita now wants to take out a second loan and try to make even more money and grow her restaurant. She dreams of having a big, thriving restaurant. Her main goal is to help her children all get educated and have better lives. She wants to move up out of poverty someday, and she feels like she is on the right track. She is so excited about her business and very ready for her next loan!

loans.use: Buy products for her small restaurant

loans.name: Bismarck Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. C. de 56 años de edad, casado con 3 hijos, 2 universitarios y uno en la secundaria, su esposa es Ing. Agronomo, trabaja en el MAGFOR; el Sr. C. tiene 4 años de laborar para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa como director de proyectos, esta solicitando su primer credito el que utilizara para mejorar su vivienda  poniendo la ceramica en el piso de su casa, pues esta embaldosado y comprar las persianas de las ventanas ya que solo tiene los protectores; su ilusion es mejorar su vivienda, ya que sus hijos estan creciendo tanto intelectual como en su desarrollo fisico, pues una sera graduado de ingeniero, otro esta en 2do año de la universidad y el otro en 3er año de bachillerato y quiere que se sientan realizados al ver su vivienda con comodidades y condiciones; su vivienda es propia, desde hace muchos años no habia podido realizar este sueño de mejorarla hasta que supo que la Alcaldia tiene convenio con AFODENIC y conoce de las excelentes politicas que no se igualan a las de los bancos que son creditos impagables o los deudores se quedan sin nada.
texts.en:
Mr. C. is 56 years old, married with three children, two of whom are college students and one who is still in high school. His wife is an agricultural engineer and works in MAGFOR. For the past four years, Mr. C. has worked in the local municipality as Project Director. He is requesting his first loan in order to improve his home, installing a ceramic floor since it is currently quite slippery; he would also like to put up blinds and glass in the windows as they currently only have bars covering them. His dream is to improve his home since his children are growing, both physically and intellectually. One will graduate soon in engineering, another is in his second year of college and the third is in his 3rd year of high school. Mr. C. would like his children to feel fulfilled in their home and see it in good condition with comfortable accommodations. He owns his home but for many years has not been able to find funds to improve it until he found out that the mayor's office has an agreement with AFODENIC which offers much better terms than banks who offer loans that debtors can never pay and they are eventually left with nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a ceramic floor and windows in his home

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Huascahura Village Bank. Mercedes is 30 years old and has two children. Mercedes has a little lunch counter in the San Ramón School, where she sells sweets, fruits, and meals every day. Mercedes also sells cheeses, which she buys from market vendors, out of her home

Mercedes needs a loan of 900 soles to buy cookies, caramels and gum. She dreams of owning her own home, of getting ahead in life, and that her children will be able to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Huascahura. Mercedes es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Mercedes tiene un cafetín en el colegio San Ramón, en donD. venD. golosinas, frutas y comida, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Mercedes venD. quesos D. casa en casa, sus productos los compra D. los feriantes.

Mercedes necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. galletas, caramelos, chicles. Mercedes sueña con tener casa propia, salir adelante y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Buy cookies, caramels, and gum for re-sale

loans.name: Sergio Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio de 48 años de edad, su esposa le tiene un hijos de 18 años de edad, lo tiene estudiando en un colegio de la capital, habita en barrio el pilar de la cuidad de Managua.
