RC Boys had never got a loan from SMT before.  They heard of SMT from colleagues in other schools who have benefited greatly from SMT’s services. They decided to form a group and send in an application to SMT requesting a loan after hearing these other success stories. With the loan, some of the staff members will start a small business and those who are already run small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children's education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects.  

Government salaries are usually quite small for teachers, thus making teaching an unattractive profession for many whose primary motivator is money. Many choose other jobs over teaching because of the small salary, thus starving the field of qualified personnel to teach the children. The few who remain in the classroom have to find other ways of making ends meet. The vast majority of them engage in either business or agriculture or they provide extra tutorial classes for the children (although this is a practice the government is trying to stop). Needless to say, loans from SMT are a great help to the teachers in order to boost their businesses or invest it in something productive. Many want to go to school but could not afford the cost. Some will want to buy pieces of furniture, but their monthly salary is not enough to let them do so. With a loan, they will be able to meet some of these needs.  And with their monthly salaries, they can repay easily via a payroll deduction type of system.

Fifty-nine year old Augustine J. Kalokoh (back row, fourth from left) is the head teacher at the school.  He was born in Makali, only a few miles from Magburaka town. He is married with five children. One is in class three, one in junior secondary school III (JSS III) and three are in senior secondary school III (SSS III). Augustine will use his loan to purchase house building materials, specifically cement for bricks. In Magburaka town, where he will do this purchase, a bag of cement will cost him Le 36,000. Augustine will use the loan to buy as many bags of cements as the loan can offer.

loans.use: Purchasing house building materials

loans.name: Slmb Ii Group

texts.en:
These are teachers from the Sierra Leone Muslim Brotherhood (SLMB II) Primary school in Magburaka. It was founded in 1961 and named after its founding mission. SLMB II caters to children between the ages of nine and twelve (classes four-six).  SLMB II has a total of 581 pupils with a staff of seventeen teachers and administrators. They are very proud of their 98% pass rate on the most recent National Primary School Exams (NPSE). Last year, of the 103 pupils sent to take the exams,102 passed successfully.   

This is the group's first loan with SMT.  They heard of SMT from colleagues in other schools who have benefited greatly from SMT’s services. The use of the loan varies amongst the teachers.  Some of the staff members will start a small business.  Those who are already small business owners will invest the loan into their businesses. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture for their domiciles and others plan to pay either for their children’s education or to pursue further studies themselves. 

Government salaries are usually quite small for teachers, thus making teaching an unattractive profession for many whose primary motivator is money. Many choose other jobs over teaching because of the small salary, thus starving the field of qualified personnel to teach the children. The few who remain in the classroom have to find other ways of making ends meet. The vast majority of them engage in either business or agriculture or they provide extra tutorial classes for the children (though this is a practice the government is trying to stop). Needless to say, loans from SMT are a great help to the teachers in order to boost their businesses or invest it in something productive. Many want to go to school but could not afford the cost. Some will want to buy pieces of furniture, but their monthly salary is not enough to let them do so. With a loan, they will be able to meet some of these needs.  And with their monthly salaries, they can repay easily via a payroll deduction type of system.

Forty-one year old Francis T. (third from right) is the head teacher at SLMB II.  He was born in Makeni Yoni, a village about forty-three miles from Magburaka town. He is married to a teacher and the two have six children.  Three of his children are in primary school and three in secondary school. Francis will invest his loan in business. He has already been in business for two years now. He buys and sells palm oil, ground-nuts and rice. With this loan, he will invest all of it in palm oil alone. He is expecting to be able to get at least twenty-five “barters” of palm oil (five gallons of palm oil make one barter). He purchases the palm oil in the nearby village of Makump, about nine miles round-trip from Magburaka.  A barter of palm oil costs something between Le 40,000 and 50,000. There are no constant prices; prices fluctuate depending on the season and the availability of the palm oil. Francis is very excited about this loan as the profit it will generate for him will make him “feel like I’ve been a successful somebody in life.”

loans.use: Buying and selling palm oil to supplement his teaching salary

loans.name: Slmb I Group

texts.en:
These are teachers from the Sierra Leone Muslim Brotherhood (SLMB I) Primary school in Magburaka. It was founded in 1961 and named after its founding mission. The SLMB School is made up of classes one through three. They cater to children between the ages of six and eight.  SLMB II caters to children between the ages of nine and twelve (classes four-six).  SLMB I has a total of 225 pupils with a staff of fourteen teachers and administrators. 

SLMB has never got a loan from SMT before.  They heard of SMT from colleagues in other schools who have benefited greatly from SMT’s services. They decided to form a group and send in an application to SMT requesting a loan after hearing these other success stories. With the loan, some of the staff members will start a small business and those who are already run small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children in their education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects. 

Government salaries are usually quite small for teachers, thus making teaching an unattractive profession for many whose primary motivator is money. Many choose other jobs over teaching because of the small salary, thus starving the field of qualified personnel to teach the children. The few who remain in the classroom have to find other ways of making ends meet. The vast majority of them engage in either business or agriculture or they provide extra tutorial classes for the children (though this is a practice the government is trying to stop). Needless to say, loans from SMT are a great help to the teachers in order to boost their businesses or invest it in something productive. Many want to go to school but could not afford the cost. Some will want to buy pieces of furniture, but their monthly salary is not enough to let them do so. With a loan, they will be able to meet some of these needs.  And with their monthly salaries, they can repay easily via a payroll deduction type of system.

Fifty-one year old Brema S. K. is the deputy head teacher at SLMB.  He was born in Masoko, on the outskirts of Magburaka town. He is married with four children. Two of his children are in primary school and the other two have already finished their schooling. Brema will use his loan in the construction of a home. He plans to buy bundles of corrugated iron zinc for roofing, nails and bricks for a strong foundation. In Magburaka, where he will make these purchases, a bundle of corrugated iron zinc will cost him Le 210,000, a box of nails Le 18,000 and each brick will cost him Le 500.

loans.use: Purchasing roofing, nails and bricks for construction of a home

loans.name: Merilou

texts.en:
A little "sari-sari" (variety) store is hoping to continually do well in Barangay Southern Poblacion. This is owned by Merilou O., 28 years of age and married. Her husband works as a laborer. "Its hard to live life, having no stable job," Merilou shared with us. A meager income is not enough, especially since she expecting their second child. They have to save for the additional member of the family.

Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative answers the capital needs of the couple. Having started with a little capital, they to wish invest more to their business. They applied for a PHP 5,000 loan. They want to purchase additional stock for their store.

They pray that their little sari-sari store will become an all-in-one grocery store. They wanted to taste a good life and improve their family situation. They dream big for their children to finish their studies. So, as early as now, they keep saving for their hopes.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her "sari-sari" (variety) store

loans.name: Sulhiyat

texts.en: Sulhiyat is a widow with 2 children. She lives in Khachmaz town. She was born in 1952. Five years ago she started a cafe business. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the necessary equipment for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy the necessary equipment for her cafe

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en: Anvar was born in 1958. He lives in Khachmaz town. This man is single. Three years ago he started this business. He transports people with his minibus. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Vilma Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Vilma Rosa  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su octavo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Terminar de repellar la casa), trabaja como docente de Educación primaria en la colonia caracito  desde hace 9 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 9 añitos de edad, a pesar que ella no recibe  ayuda del padre de su hija, no le ha faltado lo basico a su hija, la niña estudia su segundo grado de Educación primaria;  Vilma es una mujer que  se caracteriza por ser humilde en su labor de trabajo, es de escasos recursos económicos pero muy responsable con sus compromisos, su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, estabilidad laboral para así  ayudar a su madre, a sus hermanitos y a su hija, ya que ella asume en parte con los gastos familiares de su casa.
texts.en:
Vilma Rosa is requesting financing for her eighth loan, to invest into making improvements to her home (to finish plastering). She has worked as a primary school teacher in the Caracito colony for the past nine years. She is the single mother of a 9-year old daughter and, despite the fact that she doesn’t receive any support from the father, she has made sure that her child doesn’t lack any of the basic necessities. Her daughter is in her second year of primary school. Vilma is a woman characterized by being humble in her work and having scant financial resources, however she is very responsible with her commitments. Her dreams include having a home that is in better condition and stable employment so she can help out her mother, brothers and daughter, as she assumes partial responsibility for the family’s living expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plaster her house.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Doña Felipa está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para  Terminar de construir  una habitación, trabaja como conserje del hospital Jacinto Hernández desde hace 19 años, es madre soltera, tiene  2 hijos  el mayor de 16 años estudia su 3 er año de educación secundaria y una niña de 10 años estudia su 4to grado de educación primaria, a pesar que es una persona asalariada y de escasos recursos económicos  y no depende de otros ingresos ha demostrado ser una mujer muy responsables, honesta y muy trabajadora;  ella se siente agradecida con la institución de AFODENIC  ya que con los anteriores ha logrado componer  su casa ya que se encuentraba en mal estado, su mayor ilusion es tener  salud para su familia y contar con estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Felipa is requesting financing for her third loan to finish building a bedroom. She has worked as a caretaker at the Jacinto Hernández Hospital for the past 19 years. She is a single mother of two children. Her older child is 16 years old and in the 3rd year of secondary school and her younger child, a daughter, is ten and in the 4th year of primary school. Despite being a person of scarce financial resources and limited income, she has demonstrated herself as a very responsible, honest, and hard-working woman. She feels very grateful to AFODENIC since, with previous loans, she has managed to improve her home which was in a state of disrepair. Her wishes are to have a healthy family and to enjoy stable employment.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. R. forma parte de una familia de 5 integrantes ellos ya tiene mas de 8 años de habitar la misma casa, en este tiempo han empezado a surgir los problemas de humedad y por consecuencia se han dañado los acabados, como él nos cuenta; es desagradable y estresante entrar a la vivienda y lo primero que se da a notar son las manchas que va dejando la humedad, requiere impermeabilizar y reparar el cielo de la casa. Al momento de la visita al domicilio del Sr. Juan Antonio no se encontraba, el trabajo se lo impidió, en sustitución de su persona nos atendió su esposa la Sra. María Rafaela quien reafirmó las necesidades expuestas.

Solicita a ustedes su colaboración para cumplir con el objetivo trazado. En el momento que se realice la mejora los enteraremos de los resultados.
texts.en:
Mr R. has a family of 5 and they have been living in the same house for eight years. During this time dampness problems have emerged and damaged the finish. As he tells us it is uncomfortable and stressing to enter the house and the first thing you notice are the damp patches. He needs to fix the ceiling and make it waterproof. He was not home for the visit but his wife, Mrs. María Rafaela confirmed the stated necessity.

He requests your collaboration to reach the objective and we will be informed about the results as soon as they have been accomplished.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix a ceiling and make it waterproof.

loans.name: Plutarco Elías

texts.es:
El señor Plutarco C. se dedica a su negocio de venta de comida comercializada en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde ofrece todo tipo de alimentos los cuales los comercializados todos los días ofreciendo almuerzo, desayuno y cena.

Se dedica a su labor con el propósito de mantener a su familia la cual está compuesta por sus cuatro hijos que por ser pequeños debe de mantenerlos y brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es para que le sea aprobada su solicitud de crédito para proceder a la compra de la materia prima.
texts.en:
Mr. Plutarco C. sells commercialized food at the Central market of the town of Chinandega for a living, where he offers all kinds of dishes for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

His purpose is to maintain his family as he has four young children, and offer them the necessary conditions for their development, and therefore he hopes his request will be approved by Ceprodel so he can proceed to purchase raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Estela C. originaria de la bella ciudad de Chinandega labora atendiendo su propia tienda general el cual ofrece diferentes tipos de artículos tales como personales,  del hogar y también comestibles.

Ella es el único sustento de su hogar y es por esto que  se preocupa por mejorar las condiciones de su casa de habitación es por esta sencilla razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito ya que sus estantes se han vuelto vacíos y ella requiere volverlos a llenar y para ello espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs Rosa Estela C. is from the beautiful town of Chinandega where she owns a general store offering different articles for personal use, household goods as well as food.

She is the only support of her home and therefore she worries about improving conditions of her house and for that reason she has approached Ceprodel for a loan as her shelves are empty and she needs to fill them and she hopes her loan will be approved so she can continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for general store.

loans.name: Mayra Argentina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Mayra L. se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos del hogar y electrodomésticos los cuales los vende en ocasiones ambulantemente y a veces es visitada por su familia. Ella se dedica arduamente a su actividad con el único propósito de mantener su hogar y suplir las necesidades de este.

Ha acudido al apoyo de Ceprodel con el cual obtener el crédito oportuno para la compra de electrodomésticos para comercializarlos. También es importante destacar que ella vende leña en su casa pero en menores cantidades. Espera que el crédito sea otorgado para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
In the town of Chinandega, Mrs. Mayra L. sells household goods and electrical appliances for a living. On occasion she sells as a street vendor and sometimes her family visits. She works arduously with the purpose of maintaining her home and fulfilling the domestic necessities.

She has approached Ceprodel to obtain a loan to purchase electrical appliances to be commercialized. It is also important to mention that she sells firewood but in small amounts. She hopes to obtain the loan to be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Miriam Nicolasa

texts.es: La profesora Miriam es soltera, de 44 años de edad, con 13 años de servicio en el sector educativo, en su vivienda habitan 9 personas, 4 adultos y 5 niños, de los niños 4 son nietos a quien ella les ayuda con la comida, pues las mamás que son sus hijas trabajan en Managua, todos estudian, 2 de sus hijos estudian el 3ero y 5to año de secuntdaria con 14 y 18 años de edad, los niños estan en las edades de 3-7-8-9 y 11 años quienes estudian la primaria.  La profesora se levanta a las 4 a.m. para dejar los alimentos preparados para sus hijos y nietos, luego a las 6:00 a.m. se marcha hacia su centro de trabajo en la zona rural regresando a las 4:00 pm. Estás solicitando su 6to credito para realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda como son cerrar con alambre de púas el patio, pues con lo solicitado no podria cerrarlo con una tapia pues es muy costoso y poner las verjas a las ventanas para dar un poco de seguridad a su vivienda, ya que estas fechas los desocupados se apoderan de lo ajeno.
texts.en:
Miriam is a single, is a teacher and is 44 years old. She has been an educator for 13 years. Nine people live in her home, 4 adults and 5 children. Four of the children are her grandchildren that Miriam helps with food because their mothers, who are Miriam’s daughters, work in Managua. All of the children are in school. Two of her sons are in their third and fifth years of secondary school, as they are 14 and 18 years old. The children are 3, 7, 8, 9, and 11 years old and are in primary school. The teacher wakes up at 4:00 am to leave food prepared for her children and grandchildren. Later, at 6:00 am she goes to the work in the center of the rural area and returns at 4:00 pm. She is requesting her sixth loan so that she can make some improvements in her home, like to enclose her patio in barbed wire. With the amount she is requesting, she would not be able to enclose it with a stone wall because that is very expensive. With the loan, she will also put bars on the windows to give her home a little more security because these days the unemployed steal from people.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fence off her property and put protection on the windows

loans.name: Henry Rosalio

texts.es: Don Henry está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 8vo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de los servicios Higienicos), trabaja como Análista de crédito en FINCA NICARAGUA,     tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de 13 años estudia 2do año de educación secundaria, la otra hija de 11 años estudia 6to grado de Educación primaria y el niño menor de 3 añitos, su esposa trabaja en el mercado munipal de Nueva Guinea, ambos comparte los gastos del hogar; don Henry es un hombre profesional responsable, honesto, trabajador, vive en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas, actualmente  esta estudiando un  postgrado   en la Univesidad  URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea,    su sueño es seguir  estudiando, tener salud, estabilidad laboral y en el futuro tener una casa bonita con todas las condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Henry would like to refinance his eighth loan to invest in constructing a bathroom in his home. He is a credit analyst at FINCA NICARAGUA and has three children. His oldest is 13 and in the second year of secondary school, his 11-year-old daughter is in sixth grade, and his youngest is 3 years old. His wife works in his neighborhood's market and they both share responsibility for household expenses.

Henry is a responsible, honest, hard-working professional. He lives in Zone 6 of the Nueva Guinea neighborhood, where the population grows by the day. He is currently doing postgraduate work at the Nueva Guinea campus of URACCAN University. He dreams of continuing his studies and of having good health, employment security, and a beautiful, well-appointed home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a bathroom

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María C. originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega labora en su propia casa de habitación donde atiende su propia pulpería que la ha venido desarrollando desde hace varios años y ha logrado salir adelante en este negocio.

La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de sus productos para su respectiva comercialización y es por este sencilla razón que espera que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para continuar con su negocio en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mrs. María C. comes from the city of Chinandega. She works in her home, where she takes care of her own general store, which she has carried out for some time, and she has succeeded in going forward in this business.

She has requested a loan from Ceprodel to buy her products to market. She is also hoping that her credit will be granted satisfactorily so that she can continue with the business in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Nora Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Nora Cecilia está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de los servicios higienicos), vive en la zona # 1 de Nueva Guinea trabaja como secretaria del centro de Enseñanza CETA INATEC,  ubicada en la colonia Yolaina a 8 km de Nueva Guinea, Nora  todos los días tiene que viajar a las 6 de la mañana a sus centro de trabajo,  tiene  3 hijos, el mayor tiene 25 años de edad, la otra hija tiene 18 años de edad, estudia  su 1er año en la univesidad  URACCAN y la menor de 15 años, estudia su 4to año de educación secundaria, Nora es  madre soltera que ha luchado para sacar a sus hijos adelante sin la ayuda del padre de ellos, su hijo mayor trabaja y le ayuda a su madre con los gastos familiares del hogar ya que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos,  pero  con alto espiritu de superación personal y laboral, se caracteriza por ser muy responsable, ama su trabajo, sueña con tener estabilidad laboral, salud  y una vivienda con mejores condiciones ya que es patrimonio que tiene para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nora Cecilia is requesting refinancing for her seventh loan. She will used it to improve her home by constructing a bathroom. She lives in Zone 1 of the Nueva Guinea neighborhood and is a secretary at the CETA INATEC Education Center in Yolaina. Since the center is located 8 kilometers (5 miles) from Nueva Guinea, Nora has to begin her daily commute to work at 6 am.

Nora has three children: a 25-year-old son who works and helps with household expenses, an 18-year-old daughter who is in her freshman year of college at URACCAN, and an 15-year-old daughter in her fourth year of secondary school. Nora is a single mother who has struggled to help her children get ahead without the support of their father. They are a family of scarce resources, but with great desire for personal and career advancement.

Nora is very responsible and loves her job. She dreams of having stable work, good health, and a more comfortable home to pass on to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a bathroom

loans.name: Gloria Eufemia

texts.es:
La señora Gloria V. desde hace 20 años labora en el negocio de venta de mariscos los que son comercializados en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se desempeña. Se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente trabajadora que para mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia se ha esforzado grandemente para sacarlos adelante.

Hoy en día espera que Ceprodel le brinde el apoyo por medio de la obtención de un crédito para la compra de sus mariscos y espera muy confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado sin ningún problema y así logrará llevar a cabo su actividad.
texts.en:
For twenty years, Gloria V. has sold seafood in Chinandega's Central Market. She has worked hard to improve her quality of life and to help her family get ahead.

She hopes that Kiva's partner Ceprodel will support her with a loan to purchase seafood. She is confident that her loan will be granted without a problem and in that way she will be able to continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seafood

loans.name: Loyda Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. F., soltera, de 39 años de edad con 1 hijo, lo tiene su papá, pero ella le ayuda.  Está solicitando su credito # 3, el que utilizara para la construciion de un baño y su cocina, trabaja como auxiliar de enfermeria con 16 años de servicio en el Centro de Salud de Acoyapa, sus 2 creditos anteriores los ha utilizado para la construccion de su vivienda, pues es hasta con los creditos que AFODENIC le ha otorgado que ella cuenta con una vivienda, le faltan muchas condiciones, pero espera que con futuros creditos podria llegar a contar con una vivienda digna que es lo que todo ser humano.  Sus creditos anteriores los ha pagado en tiempo y forma es una excelente clienta, cuenta con el respaldo moral de su jefe y compañeros de trabajo, manifiesta que por ningun motivo se retirara de AFODENIC, pues esta satisfecha con la atencion que es recibida cuando se presena a la institucion, ya que todo su personal es muy especial.
texts.en:
Ms. F. is 39 years old and single. She has one son who lives with his father, but she helps support him. For sixteen years she has worked as a nurse's aide in the Acoyapa Health Center. She is requesting her third loan, which she will use to construct a bathroom and a kitchen. Her two previous loans were used to build her house. In fact, without Kiva's partner AFODENIC Ms. F. would not have a house. The house still lacks many amenities, but she is confident that with continued support she will have a decent home, just as all human beings deserve. She has repaid her previous loans on time and is an excellent client. Her boss and colleagues give her moral support.

Ms. F. attests that she will never withdraw from AFODENIC because she is very satisfied with their service and she believes that all of the staff are very special.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom and kitchen

loans.name: Raquel Marie

texts.es: La Sra. Raquel, casada, de 44 años de edad, con 2 hijos de 19 y 22 años (mujer y varon), ambos trabajan y estudian la universidad, recibe el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en la Policica Nacional, ella trabaja en las universidades UNAN y UNA los dias jueves, viernes, sabados y domingos, con 10 años de trabajo en la docencia superior; esta solicitando su credito # 5 el que utilizara para ponerle el piso de ceramica a su casa, ya que es una casa de proyecto y se se las entregaron embaldozadas, ademas pintara toda la vivienda si el presupuesto ajusta.  La profesora Raquel ha pagado sus creditos en tiempo y forma demostrando responsabilidad con sus compromisos adquiridos, esta catalogada como clienta "A" de esta institucion.  Manifiesta que no ha trabajado con ninguna otra financiera porque no le gustan las politicas, mientras que con AFODENIC ella se siente bien atendida y las politicas son mas flexibles, ademas dice que continuara trabajando con sus creditos hasta lograr dar todas las condiciones a su vivienda que es lo que siempre han soñado ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Senora Raquel is married, 44, and has 2 children ages 19 and 22, a girl and a boy. Both children work and attend the university. She receives the support of her husband who works for the National Police, and she has been teaching at the upper level for 10 years in UNAN and UNA Universities Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday. She is requesting her fifth loan, which she will use to put down a tile floor in her home, since it is a work in progress and the tiling has been started. She will also paint the whole house if the budget allows. Professor Raquel has paid her loans on time, demonstrating her responsibility to the commitments she has undertaken. She is rated as an "A" client of this institution. She has demonstrated that she has not worked with any other financial institution because she does not like politics, but she feels very well-served with AFODENIC and the rules are more flexible. She says as well that she will keep working with her loans until she has completed all the improvements to her home that she and her family have always dreamed.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lay tile and paint her house

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es: El joven Jose Saul, casado, de 31 años de edad, trabaja en la comunidad de Santa Clara, como profesor de multigrado desde hace 7 años, viaja los dias lunes y regresa el dia viernes, su esposa trabaja en el Ministerio de Educacion como concerje, ella tiene 27 años de edad y no tienen hijos.  El joven Jose Saul utilizo su primer credito para mejora de su vivienda, y en ese momento lo que compro fue zinc y madera para su casita, con este 2do credito comprara materiales de construccion y hara los arranques para iniciar una construccion formal de su vivienda, esta interesado en adquiriri una vivienda digana para cuando lleguen sus hijos, es una persona responsable y con muchos deseos de superacion, una vez pagado este credito continuara con otros hasta alcanzar su meta de ver su casa terminada con las condiciones necesarias para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Saul, 31, is married. He's worked as a teacher in the community of Santa Clara for 7 years. He travels there on Mondays and returns home on Fridays. His wife, 27, works as an attendant at the Ministry of Education. They have no children. Jose Saul used his first loan to make improvements to his house. He bought lumber and roofing for the project. With his second loan, he will buy more construction materials and make additional improvements. He wants to have a decent place to live before any future children arrive. He's a responsible person, eager to get ahead. Once he pays this loan, he'll borrow again until he reaches his goal of building a house fit for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for house.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: La Sra. T., soltera, de 54 años de edad, trabajadora del Hospital Asuncion como responsable de Recursos Humanos con 27 años de servicio, esta solitando su 9no credito, el que utilizara para la construccion de un sumidero, ya que con creditos anteriores no habia querido hacerlo debido a la escases de agua en la ciudad, pero en estos momentos se cuenta con un proyecto de agua potable y ya la ciudad no tendra problemas de agua.  Doña Olga habita en su casa con su hija y un nieto, ella les apoya ya que su hija es Lic. en Contabilidad pero no ha encontrado trabajo, ella se siente muy contenta de trabajar con AFODENIC ya que siempre ha sido bien atendida y en cuanto a sus pagos los ha hecho con responsabilidad, en ningun retraso, categorizado como clienta "A".
texts.en:
Sra. T., 54, is single. She is a Human Resources manager at the Asuncion Hospital where she's worked for 27 years. This will be her ninth loan. She will use it to build a drainage system, something that she hasn't wanted to do before because the city was short of water. That's not a problem now because the city's water system has been upgraded. Olga's daughter and grandson live with her. She supports them because her daughter hasn't been able to find work even though she has a degree in Accounting. Olga is very happy to work with AFODENIC because they've always been helpful. She, in turn, has shown herself to be responsible, never in arrears, and a Class A customer.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a drainage system.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El señor Sergio Ángeles tiene ya mas de trece años dedicándose a polarizar los cristales de los automóviles este es su negocio y el ingreso de su familia.
A el se le  presento una oportunidad de comprar el material por mayoreo en la ciudad de Monterrey, México. Pero no cuenta con el dinero para hacer la compra de inmediato.
Esta solicitando un préstamo y así poder obtener esa oferta que se le esta presentando en este momento. Esto le permitirá comprar la mercancía a un precio bajo y no tendrá que viajar frecuentemente para realizar la compra de ese producto.
texts.en:
Sergio A. has thirteen years of experience working with tinted car windows. This is his job and how he earns money for his family. He has an opportunity to buy materials at a wholesale price in Monterrey, Mexico, but he does not have the money to purchase the materials right now. He is asking for a loan to be able to take advantage of this opportunity. This loan will allow him to buy the materials at a low price and he will not have to travel frequently in order to buy this product.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda P. y su esposo el señor Enrique Vazquez se han encargado de darles lo mejor a sus hijos desean que terminen sus estudios.
Ella trabaja vendiendo comidas en diferentes partes de la cuidad de Nuevo Laredo, México, y  su esposo trabaja en un taller de reparación de autos. De está manera generan ingresos para su familia.
Con un crédito anterior de FVP construyo un cuarto pero aun le faltan los acabados del exterior y el techo de concreto para que esté más seguro y duradero.
Ella está solicitando el préstamo para terminar la construcción, y planean pagarlo con los ingresos de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yolanda Perez and her husband Mr. Enrique Vazquez are responsible for giving the best to their children, and want them to finish school. Yolanda sells food in different parts of the city of Nuevo Laredo, Mexico, and her husband works in an auto repair shop. These jobs are how they generate income for their family. With a previous loan from FVP they built a room. They still need to finish the exterior and the concrete roof to make the building safer and stronger. She is asking for this loan to finish the construction and she will repay it using the income from her and her husband's jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Exterior finishings and concrete slabs

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier Gutiérrez es padre de familia tiene un hijo que actual mente está estudiando y quiere lo mejor para el.
El trabaja  para una compañía  de construcción en el puesto de supervisor esté es el ingreso que tiene para darles lo mejor a su familia.
Hace 5 años fue acreditado de FVP y construyó parte de su casa con el apoyo que recibió. Ahora desea terminar el interior de su casa y colocar el vitropiso.
Por ello solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar el material, ya que el hará el trabajo de colocación. Planea pagar esté préstamo con los ingresos de supervisor.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier Gutierrez is a family man who wants the best for his son, who is a student. He works as a supervisor for a construction company and with this income he gives the best to his family. Five years ago he was given a loan through FVP and he built a part of his house with the help he received. Now he would like to finish the interior of his home and install ceramic tile floors. For this project he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy the materials. He will do the installation by himself and plans to repay the loan with his income as a construction supervisor.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ceramic tiles

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: El Sr. Gilberto vive con su esposa al sur de la ciudad, en un fraccionamiento prácticamente recién formado, sus ingresos provienen de la venta de tacos por las mañanas y del empleo que tiene en un centro comercial de la ciudad, mas sin embargo él desea que lo apoyen para la compra de un vehiculo para poder trasladarse mas rápido a las zonas de venta, actualmente tienen un carrito pero ya se encuentra en muy malas condiciones y realizarle las reparaciones saldría mas costoso. La venta de tacos es un gran ingreso que necesitan conservar para mantenerse. Se les agradecerá infinitamente el apoyo que les den y por supuesto les llevaremos el seguimiento de esta familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Gilberto lives with his wife in the south side of the city, in a fairly new subdivision; his income originates from the sale of tacos in the mornings and a job in a shopping mall downtown; however, he would like help to purchase a vehicle that he can use to travel quicker to the centers of commerce. Presently they have a small car that is very bad shape, and which would be very expensive to repair. The sale of tacos is a good source of income that they absolutely must maintain to live on. They would be ever so grateful for any help they receive; we will maintain everyone updated on the progress of this family.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To obtain a vehicle for the sale of tacos.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier H.  es padre de familia y vive en un cuarto que le presto un familiar.
Como desea tener un patrimonio seguro para su esposa e hijo está tramitando una casa por medio de Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental) pero el valor de la vivienda es superior al crédito que el puede recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo.
El trabaja en una compañía de limpieza industrial. Por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para poder completar el crédito Gubernamental y así adquirir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Javier Hernandez is a head of household who lives in a room loaned to him by a relative. He wants a real home for his wife and child, so he is trying to buy a house through Infonavit (government credit agency). However, due to his low income the cost of the home is higher than the amount of money that he can borrow from the government. He works for an industrial cleaning company. He is requesting funds to supplement the government loan, so that he can buy this home.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Funds to supplement government loan for the purchase of a home

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
Maria Juana G. hace tiempo había tenido su tienda de abarrotes pero comenta que se le fue abajo por dar muchos créditos a clientes y fue notando que su mercancía fuera agotándose y sin darse cuenta ya no tenia bien surtido. Por el momento ella esta vendiendo chicharrones y refrescos lo cual le esta favoreciendo y vendiendo muy bien por lo que quiere volver a surtirse de todo.
La cantidad que ella nos solicita es la cantidad  de $10,000 pesos.
texts.en:
Maria Juana G. used to own a grocery store, but it failed due to the excessive amount of credit given to customers, and the fact that she didn't replenish her diminishing inventory. Currently she is selling pork rinds and soft drinks very successfully; this has given her the encouragement to buy merchandise and restock her store once again. She is requesting $800.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es: Maria Teodora M. V. es una persona que quiere sacar a sus hijos adelante ella es madre soltera. Su casa se encuentra en esquina comenta que como no esta bardeada la gente utiliza su patio como pasada.  Es por  ello  que la señora Maria Teodora desea poner malla ciclónica para obstruir el paso de otras personas ajenas lo cual esta dando inseguridad a sus hijos como a ella misma. La cantidad que ella nos solicita es de $4,000 pesos. La señora M. trabaja en una maquiladora con estos ingresos pagara el préstamo.
texts.en:
Maria Teodora M. V. is a single mother who wants to provide her children with opportunities to move forward. Her house is located on the corner and she says since it's not fenced in, people use her patio as a path. Because of this, Mrs. Maria Teodora wants to put mesh fence to keep others out so that they stop endangering the security of her children and herself. She is asking for $4,000 pesos. Mrs. M. works in an assembly plant and will be able to pay off the loan with her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a fence

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es:
Doña Gloria, tiene su puesto de tacos y lo atiende junto con su hija, solo son ellas dos, cada día a partir de las 8 de la mañana se dan la tarea de realizar la venta de los alimentos y cerca de las 11 de la noche terminan, sin excepción alguna ellas atienden a sus clientes.

Quieren aumentar la variedad de sus productos para satisfacción de los clientes, este ingreso es vital para salir adelante con todos los gastos de su casa; apoyarlas en su proyecto sería fantástico
texts.en:
Dona Gloria has a taco stand which she works at with her daughter. It is just the two of them. Each day at 8am in the morning, they begin the task of selling the food and around 11pm in the evening they finish. Without exception, there is always one of them attending to their customers. They want to increase the variety of their products to satisfy the needs of their customers. This money is vital to continue forward with their living expenses; your support of their project would be wonderful.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in ingredients

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro G. C. no pudo estar en la foto por la razón que el es chofer de carga pesada y siempre esta fuera de la ciudad su esposa la señora Laura Mallel Ruiz Medina que es ama de casa se dejo tomar fotografía con sus dos hijos. El señor Ramiro G. C. ya había tenido un préstamo aquí el cual pago muy bien es por eso que nosotros pensamos darle otro. En este nuevo crédito Ramiro pide un préstamo para mejorar su casa. Los arreglos que el desea hacer, como podrán ver en la imagen es enjarrarla y darle un pintadita al color que su esposa le guste. La cantidad que el nos solicita es de $10,000 pesos
texts.en:
Ramiro G. C. was not able to be in the photo because he is a truck driver and is always out of town. His wife, Mrs. Laura Mallel Ruiz Medina is in the photo with their two children. Mr. Ramiro G. C. has already had a loan which he paid back fully. Because of this, we are confident about giving him another loan. With this next loan, Ramiro has asked for a loan to work on his house. He wants to make a few improvements, such as plastering the house and painting it his wife's favorite color his wife (see house in background of picture). He is asking for a loan of $10,000 pesos.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint and cement

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa Carvajal F. es madre soltera pero que piensa en el futuro de su hijo. Ella nos comenta que su casa la fue construyendo poco a poco con ahorros, primero construyó un cuarto de madera y con el tiempo con block. Su techo era de lamina entonces se vino un aire muy fuerte que provoco que este se desprendiera y se volara ahora recurre a nosotros, pidiendo un préstamo para pagar la mano de obra ya que ella cuenta con el material para empezar a poner el techo de concreto. Para pagar al albañil solicita la cantidad de $3,000 pesos. Elsa es operadora de una maquiladora de nuestra  ciudad con estos ingreso pagara el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Elsa Carvajal F. is a single mother with her son's future in mind. She tells us that her house was built bit by bit with her savings. She built a room, first with timber and later with cement block. The roof was made of tin but it came apart in a strong wind and blew away. She's come to us now to apply for a loan to pay the labor and materials cost for a new cement roof. To pay for the work, she's asking to borrow 3,000 pesos. Elso works as an operator in a factory in our city and she will repay the loan with her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New roof.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
A 39-year-old businesswoman from Southern Poblacion, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental is battling the odds with her bakery. Loreta A. is married to Bonifacio who is her greatest aid in their bakery business. They patiently send their 5 children to school. To support the needs of the family, they work hard to sustain their business. They also raise a ittle poultry and a few pigs in their own backyard for additional income. Loreta holds the belief that with a family helping one another, business will succeed. They have taught their children to cooperate and most especially to do well with their studies.

Recently, she has applied for her 2nd loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. The amount will be used to purchase additional sacks of flour, quick dough and other baking ingredients.

The couple wish to employ baker and packers for their bakery. They feel that the Lord has blessed their business. They want to see their bakery to grow big, but nothing is more fulfilling than to see their children earn their diplomas.

loans.use: Purchase additional sacks of flour, quick dough and other baking ingredients

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida C., a 33-year-old member of Mangrove 1 Center, is making a living from fishing and selling seafoods. Her husband never misses a single day to have a catch, just to make sure to provide for the family. Their children, aged 10 and 9, are doing well in school. The couple works a lot. They know that if they do not save enough, it will be harder for them when heavy rains and winds hit the sea.

To augment their situation, they applied to Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for a PHP 20,000 loan. They wanted to purchase three additional fishing nets and invest in a motorized pumpboat. Now, they only rent a pumpboat.

In the future, they really hope to own number of motorized pumpboats. They also look forward to seeing their children establish their own careers.

They cannot have imagined how life has changed because of Paglaum MPC, they shared.

loans.use: Purchase 3 fishing nets and invest a motorized pumpboat

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn A., a 44-year-old woman from Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental is stretching her vegetable vending in the market. There is no hint that Marilyn A. is a single mother to her only daughter. She has bravely raised and sent her child to school. She recalls that she and her partner were together for only 2 months. Since then, she has stood on her own feet to survive. She promised herself not to stop living.

Vegetable vending is the only thing she knows to make an income. She also maximized her presence in the market and invested in buying and selling of other stuff. Both then and now, Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative supported Marilyn. She applied for a loan for PHP 10,000. The amount will be used for additional kilos of vegetables and spices.

She pictures herself owning an additional market stall one day. She also made a vow for her daughter that she will support her studies all the way.

"Life must go on," she ended our interview.

loans.use: To purchase for additional kilos of vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock a small grocery store and increase her income.

loans.name: Telman

texts.en: Telman was born in 1973. He is single and lives in Khachmaz town. This man has repaired cars for 5 years. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts and the necessary things for improving his auto repair business.

loans.use: Buy spare parts and the necessary things for improving his business

loans.name: Viola Banuelos

texts.en:
Viola B., 51 years old with 5 kids, happily earns a living from raising pigs in their own backyard.  She is lovingly supported by her husband, Gorjuano, who also does farming.  The couple never gets tired in finding means to provide for the family. They just make it a hobby but at the same time a way to make an income. Seasonal produce from farming augments the income of the family.

When they got the idea of swine production, Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative provided the capital. They applied for a PHP 10,000 loan. Aside from purchasing additional pigs, they will also pay expenses for animal feed.

The entire family hopes to prosper in their swine production. The success of their business promises a good life for all of them.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs for swine production

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat lives in Khachmaz town. He is single. This young man was born in 1983. Three years ago he started a mobile phones sales business. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy phone accessories to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy phone accessories

loans.name: Chimnaz

texts.en:
In the picture you can see Chimnaz, who bakes very delicious cakes. She is married and has 2 children. She lives in Khachmaz.She was born in 1965 and 4 years ago, she started this business.

Chimnaz bakes cakes for sale. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy butter, flour and necessary things for baking the tasty cakes.

loans.use: to buy butter, flour  and other necessary things for baking cakes

loans.name: Rahib

texts.en: Rahib was born in 1981. He lives in Khachmaz town. This man has been in this business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy discs and audio cassettes for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy discs, audio cassettes

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin lives in Khachmaz town. He was born in 1969. This man transports loads with his truck. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts for this truck. He started this business ten years ago.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en: Parvana was born in 1964. She lives in Khachmaz town. This woman is a widow with 2 children. She sells persimmons. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy  fruits and vegetables to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nail

texts.en: Nail was born in 1984. He lives in Khachmaz town. Three years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts for his truck. He transports loads.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir H. is 53 years old and is married.  He fled to Bilasuvar during Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict in 1993. Twenty years ago, he started his business of raising cattle. His primary business is with the local bazaar and restaurants. Also, during harvest season, Tahir works as a field-hand to help with the harvest. Despite having two jobs, his business is still quite small and doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Tahir would like to request a loan to expand his business. He will use the profit generated by the business to repay the loan on time. Tahir is asking for a loan of 1200 USD in order to buy more calves to raise. Tahir thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: Purchase four calves

loans.name: Jeykhun

texts.en:
Jeykhun H. is a good father, a hard-working farmer, and steadfast in his endeavor of raising animals. Thanks to his wife’s assistance, he is able to raise and feed the animals and prepare them for sale at both fairs and marketplaces in nearby towns.

Jeykhun has three childen. He buys calves for low prices, feeds them and after three-four months, sells them. Jeykhun would now like to increase the number of cattle he is raising and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD. He promises to be responsible and prompt in repaying it.

loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en:
At 44 years of age, Yadigar K. is married and has three adorable daughters. His principal work is the buying and selling of cattle. This business requires lots of strength because he needs to wake up early in the morning, pasture his calves outside, worry about vaccinations. This necessitates considerable financial means.

The business is very profitable, but his lack of capital makes his income insignificant, and living conditions remain difficult in his household. To strengthen his business, he is asking for a loan of 1200 USD, which will serve to buy more cattle to expand his business. This will allow him to effectively meet the needs of his household.

loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Gulovsha

texts.en:
Gulovsha F. lives in an Internally Displaced People Settlement of the southern part of Azerbaijan. She fled to this part of the country during the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict in 1993. She had a very hard life, especially in the new place, adapting to other climate conditions, without any financial support.

Gulovsha is bringing up her five children. Her husband works with her in their cattle business. Their income does not provide enough money to cover their children’s education, so Gulovsha is looking for alternatives. Gulovsha is currently requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase more calves; she hopes to expand her business in order to continue to support her family and her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz H. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and five children in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He supports his family by raising cattle, which he sells to a butcher shop in the local market after fattening them to the desired size over the course of six or eight months.

Eyvaz recently realized that his business has the potential for significant growth, so he has decided to purchase four more calves. In order to achieve this goal, which will allow him to earn more profit and better support his family, Eyvaz is requesting a loan of 1200 USD.

loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in more clothing to move a small business forward.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To add men's clothing to her inventory and improve her business.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Mr. Sek S., age 44, is the father of six children, all in school. They live together in Pursat Province. He is a rice farmer who has been farming for over 20 years, making an income of approximately US$ 2 each day. His wife, Mrs. Koam Hun, 44, is a vegetable farmer who grows cabbages and morning glories behind her home.

In order to earn additional income and make progress in their businesses, S. has requested a loan to purchase a piglet and a cow. (Mr. S.'s wife and his two daughter are pictured because he was not available.)

loans.use: to purchase a piglet and a cow

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mrs. Im S. is 41 years old, a resident of Pursat Province, and makes a living selling different kinds of vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbages, morning glories, and papayas in the local Pursat Market. She took up this business in 1990 and it is the main source of income for the family's food. She is married with four children, all of whom are female and are going to school. Her husband, Mr. Yem Rin, 43, is a rice farmer as well as selling fish. S. is applying for a loan to purchase two buffalo to make her husband's farming easier.

loans.use: to purchase two buffalo to use in farming

loans.name: Pov Seng's Group

texts.en:
The following are members for a group loan through Maxima. In the group there are two families. All the group members live along National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1. Mrs. Pov S., 40, and her husband, Mr. By Em, married in 1989 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them study in the local school. Pov has been selling grocery items for two years. She buys them from Ta Khmao market for re-sale at her house. Her husband has been a chef for twenty years. He cooks for wedding ceremonies and other ceremonies in their village and nearby villages. Pov is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to purchase a motorbike for her children to ride to school.

2. Mrs. Sokny E., 34, and her second husband, Mr. Ra Hau, 33, married in 2006. Sokny has five sons, four of whom are with her first husband. One of her sons has full-time employment; three sons attend school and the other one is still young and stays at home. Sokny has been selling clothes for ten years. She buys them from the market in Phnom Penh for re-sale at Ta Khmao market. Her husband has been fishing for two years. Sokny is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 200 to purchase more clothes for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to ride to school; to buy clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny B., 27, and her husband, Mr. Run Kong, 24, live in a small village across Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2005 and have one little son.

Mrs. Vanny has been selling silk mangoes and food for two years. She cooks by herself for resale from her home. Her husband has been a horse cart driver and wooden house builder for three years. He learned his skills from his neighbors.

Vanny is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase mangoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes for resale.

loans.name: Ky

texts.en:
Mrs. Ky N., 52, and her husband, Mr. Nov Huo, 48, who live in a small village off of National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1983 and have six children, two sons and four daughters. Four of her children are married and live outside the family house; one child is a garment factory worker and the other one attends school.

Ky has been selling vegetables in her village for fifteen years. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for twenty years. Ky is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to purchase a motorbike for her child to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her child to drive to work

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok U., 58, is a widow with three daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family house, and the youngest daughter assists her mother in producing vermicelli. The family lives in a small village off of National Road 5, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. U. has been producing vermicelli (Khmer noodle) for forty years; it’s a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her Khmer fresh noodles from one village to another. In addition, the family also has a plot of land in which they are planting corn, other food crops, vegetables, and rice. Mrs. U. is requesting a loan of $600 US to purchase firewood and rice for producing vermicelli for selling.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and rice for producing vermicelli.

loans.name: At Phorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. At P. (shown in the middle) was selected to be a leader by group members for a loan from Maxima. In the group, there are three families including hers. The entire group is living on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. At P., 65, and her husband, Mr. Sim C., 61, were married in 1965 and have four children: one son and three daughters. All of her children are married, and three live outside the family house, while the youngest daughter and her husband assist At in her silk weaving business. At has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old; silk weaving is a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished product to the middleman, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a farmer; he grows vegetables. At is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

Mrs. Sam-ang C. (shown in the picture on the right), 38, and her husband, Mr. Mom At, 38, were married in 1989 and have seven children: one son and six daughters. Three of her children are garment factory workers and the other four children attend school. Sam-ang has been a silk weaver since she was thirteen years old; silk weaving is a skill she learned from her mother. She also taught her husband to be a silk weaver. They sell their finished product to the middleman, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market. Sam-ang is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

Sam-oeun C., 22, and her husband, Mr. Ne Van, 23, were married in 2007 and have one little son. Sam-oeun has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old; silk weaving is a skill she learned from her mother. She also taught her husband to be a silk weaver. They sell their finished product to the middleman, who them takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Sam-oeun is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheap H., 33, and his wife, Mrs. Sokleap Chea, 32, were married in 1993 and have three sons. Two of them attend school and the youngest one is still young and stays at home. The family lives on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.
 
Mr. Sopheap has been a silk weaver since he was married. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old; weaving is a skill she learned from her mother. They sell their finished product to the middleman, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Therefore, Sopheap is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Chet

texts.en: Mrs. Chet S., age 27, has been running a small store in her home for selling groceries since 2007. She lives in Pursat Province. She has no child and is married to Mr. Clot Viet, 26, who makes a living by driving a taxi motorcycle. By transporting a passenger or merchandise and charging service, he earns approximately $2 per day. Recently, Viet has not attracted enough customers because his motorcycle often has problems. Hence, he and his wife decided to apply for a loan to replace the old motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi motorcycle to replace an old one.

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoem L., 40, is a widow with seven children: three sons and four daughters. One of them is married, two sons are masons, and one daughter is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh City.

Yoem is a housewife and takes care of her children. The main income in the family is from her children’s salary. Currently, her children travel to work by motor taxi, which costs more than travel by a personal motorbike. Therefore, Sopheap is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase one motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase one motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Dy, 53, is a widow with two daughters, one married and living outside the family home and the other a weaver. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

A silk weaver since 1979, a skill she learned from her mother, C. sells her finished products to the middleman who then sells them in Phnom Penh. She is now requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more silk material to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoeun L. and her husband, Mr. Sin Kroch, both 46-year-old silk weavers living on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1980 and have five children, two sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family house; three study in local school, and one daughter is acquiring tailoring skills.

Hoeun has been a silk weaver for 20 years, a skill she learned from her relatives. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Hoeun is now requesting a loan of $600 to purchase additional silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch K., 36, and her husband, Mr. Kosal Oem, 40, who live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1989 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Both of their daughters are assisting their aunt selling food in Phnom Penh; three sons study in local school, and the youngest stays at home.

Touch, a silk weaver since she was 17 years old, a skill she learned from her mother, sells her finished products to the middleman, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason since their marriage. Touch is now requesting a loan of $250 to purchase more silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy S., 34, and her husband, Mr. Yoeun Khiev, 41, who live along National Road Number One about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2006 and have no children. Her father resides with them.

Chanthy has been growing rice for ten years and selling locally-purchased vegetables for five years at a market in Phnom Penh, assisted by her husband. She is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fertilizer for farming and to expand her vegetable-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for farming and to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mr. Sor C., 37, and his wife, Mrs. Un Chhoy, 35, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1989 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Three of their children study in local school and the youngest son has not yet started his education.

Sor and his wife have been farming since they were young, growing vegetables and rice on their village land. Additionally, he is frequently hired by local villagers to carry rice and soil with his truck, thereby earning extra income. Sor is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a pesticide applicator for the farming business and a horse for resale.

loans.use: To purchase one pesticide applicator and a horse for resale.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan C., 53, and her husband, Mr. Thy Khem, 56, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1973 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home and the other two children are assisting their parents in growing rice.

Chan has been selling Mam, a Cambodian food that she makes from small fish and papaya, for ten years. Her husband is a rice farmer and rice miller. Chan is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cattle for plowing.

loans.use: To purchase cattle for plowing.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy N., 46, and her husband, Mr. Heng Siem, 48, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1980 and have eight children: four sons and four daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home; two children are silk weavers; another two are a farmer and fisherman, and the three youngest attend school.

Sophy has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from fellow villagers, and a farmer since 1982, selling her finished products to the middleman who resells them in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been farming and fishing since 1979. The couple is in the process of building their new house but lack the money to finish the project. Therefore, Sophy is requesting a loan of $600 for that purpose.

loans.use: To build the stair rail and hand rail of her house.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn T. (pictured with her mother), 29, and her husband, Mr. Chantha Thorn, 28, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2007 and have one daughter. Also residing with them are Chanthorn’s mother and brother.

Chanthorn, a silk weaver since she was 17, a skill she learned from her mother, sells her finished products to the village middleman, who resells them in Phnom Penh. She is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk material for weaving and a one-horse cart for her husband, a labourer.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and a one-horse cart.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mrs. Saret Y., 45, and her husband, Mr. Vun Kimchhun, 46, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1988 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Their sons attend school and their daughter assists her mother in selling grocery items.

Saret has been selling groceries for six years, buying them from Phnom Penh for resale at her house. Her husband has had full-time employment for ten years. Saret now wants to create another business selling diesel oil, and so is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase the oil for resale.

loans.use: To purchase diesel oil for resale.

loans.name: Srum

texts.en:
Mr. Srun M., 64, and his wife, Mrs. Yom Luch, 58, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1971 and have eight children: four sons and four daughters. Six of their children are married and live outside the family home and the other two are silk weavers.

Srun has been a wooden house builder for three years and has been farming since he was young, while his wife has been selling Cambodia cake for 30 years, buying them from a local market for resale in her village. Srun is now requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk material for his children’s weaving and for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and seed for growing rice.

loans.name: To

texts.en:
Mrs. To P., aged 24, is a resident of Prongel Commune in Pursat Province. She has been raising pigs in her backyard since 2001. 

P. has no children and married to Mr. Chaom Map, 23, who makes a living by carving statues for sale, earning him a daily income of approximately $5. P. is requesting a loan of $700 for her husband to purchase more marbles to remake a statue. This loan will eventually help their family earn additional income to sustain their daily expenses. (Mrs. P.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: to purchase more marbles to remake a statue

loans.name: Huch

texts.en:
Mrs. Huch P., 45, and her husband, Mr. Samorn Ouch, 43, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1989 and five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of her children are weavers and the other three children attend school.

Huch, who has been a silk weaver since she was 13, a skill she learned from her mother, sells her finished products to the middleman, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Her husband, on the other hand, has been raising cows for sale since they were married. Huch is now requesting a loan of $300 to purchase additional silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Chamnab

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamnab H., 29, and her husband, Mr. Sareth Choub, 35, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2001 and have two children, one attending school and the other yet too young to begin school. Chamnab’s mother and a brother who is studying in grade eleven are living with them as well.

Chamnab has been selling silk fabrics for six years and has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother, for two years. Her husband has full time employment at a company in Phnom Penh. Chamnab is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband’s commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Bet

texts.en: Mrs. Bet K., 61, lives in Khlai Village in Kampong Chham Province, Cambodia. She owns 3 hectares on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In addition to this plantation, she sells tires in the local market. This business is going well, so she wants to expand it. She is requesting a loan to buy tires to re-sell to her customers. She hopes to improve her living conditions with the increased profits.

loans.use: Buy tires to re-sell

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim L. is the group leader of four members who all live in Snay Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. The members plan to use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Yim L. is a 58-year-old widow with four children. Two children are employed in a garment factory, and the youngest child attends the local school. Another child collects palm juice and processes it into sugar or wine. This business now faces an obstacle because the pan being used to process the palm juice is too old and cannot produce a good quality palm sugar. So Mrs. Yim L. is requesting a loan to buy a new pan for her child's business.

loans.use: Buy a new pan for processing palm juice

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mr. Phal P., 58, and his wife, Mrs. Savorn Nut, 53 who live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married during the Pol Pot regime and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Two children are construction workers; a daughter works in a garment factory; one son is a security guard, while two children are in school.

Phal has been a motor taxi driver since 1992, carrying goods and people from his village to the market and from the market to the village, while his wife has worked in a brick kiln for five years. Phal is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old motor taxi and to build one rest room for family use.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and build one restroom.

loans.name: Moul

texts.en:
Moul K., 39, is married and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap, Cambodia.  This couple has four children and all of them are students. To support her family, she sells rice and other food in the village, and is able to make $5 of profit a day. Besides, selling rice and other food she also grows vegetables on a plot of land behind her house. Her husband, pictured above, is a cow dealer. He purchases and sells cows and makes $5 a day, too. 

Moul K. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to purchase more cows for her husband’s business and expand her cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase more cows and to cultivate more vegetables.

loans.name: Chhneng

texts.en: Chhneng L., 42, is married and resides with her six children and her husband in the Siem Reap, Cambodia. One of their children is married and four are students and the last one is too young to attend the school.  She is a farmer who grows corn and bananas. She has been planting fruit since 2005, and is able to make $2 of profit a day. Her husband Nou Ven, 46, is a construction worker, earning about $4 a day. On average, she spends $80 on food every month, $10 on utility and $30 on children’s education. Chhneng L. would like to take out a loan of $700 to purchase a water pump to irrigate her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Kung's Group

texts.en: The group loan includes six people who are living in Tropeang Srongae Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Kung K. is the group leader, and she is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sells it later at better price. This business is going well, and she wants to expand it. So she is requesting a loan to buy more rice to re-sell and increase her income. Her husband, Mr. Chin Vichet, helps her in the current business. Mrs. Kung K. is 51 years old and the mother of five children; three children are employed in different business activities, and the other two children are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: Buy more rice to re-sell

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen C., 38, is married and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. This couple together has two young school-aged children.  Since 2005, she has been selling fish at the market to earn a living and is able to make $5 of profit a day. She often receives fish from her husband, who works as a fisherman. He gives his catch to his wife and the rest he sells to other fish sellers in the market. On average, he makes $4 of profit a day. 
Pen C. spends $50 on food every month, $17 on utilities and $20 on children’s education. 

Pen C. would like to take out a loan of $500 to purchase more fishing tools for her husband. This will allow her husband to catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools.

loans.name: Yann

texts.en:
Yann V., 22, is married and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. This couple together has two young children. All of them are not attend the school yet. She is a grocery vendor who generally makes $2.50 of profit a day, while her husband, Sok Thai, 25, has a business breeding cows. On average, he makes $6 a day. Every month, she spends $60 on foods and $10 on utilities.

She is asking a loan of $1000 to purchase more cows for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more cows.

loans.name: Mrs. Soeurn Nem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeurn N. is the leader of an eleven-member group. All the members live in Kngoak Pong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

Mrs. Soeurn N. is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Some Phon, gathers firewood and sells it in the local village. They have six children; two children are employed in a garment factory, and the others attend the local school.
