Mrs. Sam-oun has been a silk weaver since 1975. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk material for the weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates in seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Daniel A. is a part of the Nonvignon group along with his wife, Elizabeth Houindoedji. They live in a small house near the lake with their four children. Eight years ago he left his job as a chief cook, and has since taken up fishing. Daniel fishes with his trusty net, oar, and basket. Daniel sells Sorabi (Beninese liquor) and assorted items along with his fish.

Daniel has been with Kiva for about four years. With his current loan, he will buy nets, fishing rods, and Sorabi.

loans.use: Purchase of nets, fishing rods, and Sorabi liquor

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John A. is 32 years old and is married with four children. Three of the children are in school. John lives in Rongo, Kenya.

John supports his family by making shoes. He has been making shoes for 19 years, starting when he was only 13 years old. John is applying for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Schillings in order to purchase more materials needed for making shoes.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Vanra

texts.en:
Miss. Vanra C., 26, is single. She lives with her parents and her sibling. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her mother is a silk weaver.
 
Miss. Vanra has been a silk weaver since she was fourteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk material for her loom and her mother’s loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Loung

texts.en:
Mr. Loung C., 46, and his wife, Mrs. Mao Kong, 41, live in the suburb of Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1985 and have nine children: five sons and four daughters. One of them was married and lives outside the family home, three children are garment factory workers, two children are tailors, one has full-time employment, and two children attend school.

Mr. Loung has been a tailor for two years, a skill he learned from his neighbor. His wife has been selling vegetables for about five months. Currently, he wants to create another business running a Tuk Tuk (motorbike taxi). Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase one motor taxi to earn more income to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase one motor taxi (Tuk Tuk).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mrs. Mary T., 31, and her husband, Mr. Vibol Chan, 34, who live in a small village along National Road Number 5 about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1999 and have two sons. One of her sons attends school, and the other son is still young and stays at home.

Mary has been a tailor for three years, a skill she learned from her master. She buys cloth and silk fabric from the market in Phnom Penh for resale at her tailor shop. Her husband has been a motor Remoque (taxi) driver for one year; he carries goods and people from the village to Phnom Penh and from Phnom Penh to the village.

Mary is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cloth and silk fabric for resale, and also for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and silk fabric for resale, and for growing rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of cloth for sewing clothing

loans.name: Véronique

texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates at seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Véronique K. has six children, ages 17, 23, 25, 28, 33, and 35; each educated before entering the workforce. She is a smiling, grandmother of 55 years old and has a business selling akassa to hungry locals. 

Véronique melts corn flour in a large, black cauldron in her house. Her family members help her to clean large leaves. Véronique then puts the corn flour into large leaves to make the tasty akassa snack. Akassa is her most lucrative activity, followed by the sale of motorcycle oil and charcoal. 15 years ago when she first started her business, she sold smoked fish. She gives the finished akassa snacks to others to sell, which takes them approximately three days or more to sell and pay her back. The turnaround time sometimes makes it difficult for her to make ends meet. 

In the future, she would like to increase her capacity to cook akassa by purchasing at least one extra large cooking pot.

loans.use: Purchase of akassa ingredients, charcoal, and motorcycle oil

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
A. Saodat first applied to the MicroInvest in 2007. She applied for a business development loan and, thanks to previous loans, she could open a trade outlet in the central bazaar. Mrs. A. Saodat lives in the B. Gafurov region but trades in Khujand local bazaar. She trades in fruits and has been engaged in this business for 20 years. She works with direct suppliers. She has repeat customers because she is a very polite and kind woman by nature.

Mrs. A. Saodat asks KIVA for a business development loan of 1200 STJ for 5 months to import fruits.

loans.use: Import fruit

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice O. is 42 years old and is married with seven children, three of whom are in school. Loice is a vegetable grocer in Rongo, Kenya. She has been running a vegetable stand there since 1988.

Loice is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya Schillings in order to purchase vegetables for her grocery stand.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 34-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife. He has been a painter and a contractor for three years. He requested a loan of $800 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase coal. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on schedule. Ali's clients are his friends. Thanks to a previous job, he came up with the idea of opening a coffee shop.

loans.use: Ali needs the loan to purchase coal

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Madame TOGOSSOU est née le 02 novembre 1975 à tabligo, une localité au  sud du Togo. Elle habite à Agoè Gbonné, elle a deux (02) enfants mais est divorcé de son mari ASSITO Komi qui est ferrailleur. Elle vend des friperies et s’approvisionnent chez les grossistes au marché de Hedzranawoè. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2002 et cela lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille.
Elle n’a jamais fait de prêt à WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit pour pouvoir agrandir son stock de marchandises avec trois (03) ballots.
texts.en:
Ms.TOGOSSOU was born on Novembe 12, 1975 in Tabligo, a town in southern Togo. She lives in Agoè Gbonné and has two children but is divorced from her husband, Komi ASSITO, who is a scrap metal dealer. She sells second-hand clothing and gets her supplies from wholesalers at the Hedzranawoè marketplace. She has been in this business since 2002. It enables her to provide for herself and her family. She has never gotten a WAGES loan and is requesting this initial loan to expand her stock of merchandise by three bundles

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.en:
Moustapha is a 33 year old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. He has been working as a car body repairman for 10 years. Moustapha requested a loan of 900 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase items for his household. Moustapha has been a micro credit client for seven years now and has always paid on time. 
Moustapha has a good business because he only deals with car dealers. He repairs new cars, for example cars that have been in an accident. Moustapha plans to buy a house in the future.

loans.use: Moustapha needs the loan to purchase items for his household.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: A. Matluba first applied to MicroInvest in 2007. She applied for a business development loan and thanks to previous loans she could open a trade outlet in the central bazaar. Mrs. A. Matluba trades in Khujand local bazaar. She trades in fruits and has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She has repeat customers and she is very polite and kind by nature. Mrs. A. Matluba asks KIVA for a business development loan of 2000 STJ for 6 months to open her second trade outlet in another bazaar.

loans.use: Open a second trade outlet opening in another bazaar

loans.name: Lébéné Yawavi

texts.fr:
Madame KOUMUNDJI est né le 23 janvier 1975 à lomé, elle réside dans le quartier de Kuégué, elle est divorcée de son mari  SABI Adégbiyé et a un (01) enfant. Elle est une revendeuse de cures dents (produits pour entretenir les dents), elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2003 et s’approvisionne à Kégué. Elle  fait ce commerce avec beaucoup de courage pour pouvoir soutenir sa famille.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit à WAGES pour pouvoir acheter dix huit sacs (18) de cure dents afin d’agrandir son stock.
texts.en:
Ms. KOUMUNDJI was born on January 23, 1975 in Lomé and resides in the Kuégué district. She is divorced from her husband, Adégbiyé SABI and has one child. A retailer of dental care treatments (goods for maintaining teeth) since 2003, she gets her supply of goods in Kégué. She does her work with a lot of courage, so that she can provide for her family. Her request for this initial WAGES loan is for buying 18 sacks of teeth-cleanings goods to expand her inventory.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dental care products

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is 38 years old and is married with four children. Three of her children are currently attending school. Margaret lives and works in Rongo, Kenya.

Margaret has been selling cereals in the Rongo market since 1990, and is now requesting a loan to help her purchase additional stock of cereals.

loans.use: Purchase cereals

loans.name: Idrissou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Y. Idrissou est né en 1972 à Tittigbé dans la préfecture de Sotouboua au nord du Togo. Elle réside dans le quartier d’Agoè Logopé. Il a trois (03) enfants et est divorcé de son épouse  TCHA-AKAYA roukiya. Il est revendeur de pièces détachées  dans le quartier de Kégué et s’approvisionne dans ce quartier auprès de ses fournisseurs. Il a démarré ce commerce depuis 2001 et soutient sa famille avec le revenu issu de ce commerce.
Il sollicite ce premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter  4 segments, 10 pompes à  eau et une (1) pompe à essence.
texts.en:
Mr. Idrissou Y. was born in 1972 in Tittigbé, Sotouboua Prefecture, in northern Togo. He resides in the Agoè Logopé district. He has three children and is divorced from his spouse Roukiya TCHA-AKAYA. As a retailer or spare parts in the Kégué district, he acquires his goods in that district from his suppliers. He started this business in 2001 and supports his family with the income derived from it. He is requesting this initial WAGES loan to buy 4 brake shoes, 10 water pumps, and 1 fuel pump.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Otunoy

texts.en:
M. Otunoy lives in the B. Gafurov region but she works in Khujand. She is a loving mother of 2 pretty children. Mrs. M. Otunoy is engaged in commercial service and trade. She trades in the local bazaar selling children's wear. For example, she sells seasonal wear for teenagers (jackets, sportswear and warm socks).

She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008 but she recommended herself as a serious and reliable client. Mrs. M. Otunoy applies the KIVA with a request for a business support loan of 1700 STJ for 1 month to import seasonal wear. She thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: Seasonal wear importing

loans.name: Latofat

texts.en: B. Latofat is a happy mother of 5 children. She is 48 years old and married. Latofat is a teacher. Her salary is very little so she has also been running her own grocery business. For four years she has been selling foodstuff like sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, alcoholic drinks and many others in her grocery store. Latofat’s wish is to increase her business, offering a variety of foodstuff to customers who pass through the market. She works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children who are all the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts. With this opportunity, with the immense love she feels as a mother and with her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) in order to increase the range of her goods. She promises to repay the loan within 12 months. You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting Latofat.

loans.use: Purchasing of foodstuff in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery merchandise

loans.name: Maksud

texts.en: S. Maksud is a young and energetic guy. From when he was only 16 he started his own business in order to support his parents. His business is selling housewares in one of the local markets of the city. This business allows him not only to support his family but also his own education as Maksud is studying at university. Today Maksud needs to increase the range of his goods and is asking a loan of 1000 Somoni (300 USD) for the term of 12 months. This loan will allow him to expand his business, to earn more and to realize more of his future projects. Be an important part of the growth of Maksud’s business.

loans.use: Housewares to expand his business.

loans.name: Islomjon

texts.en: N. Islomjon is 30 years old. He is married with 2 children. His wife is a housekeeper and she is taking care of their children. Thus Islomjon is the main bread winner in the family. Islomjon’s children are small now, but already he is working hard to ensure the best future for them. For more than 5 years Islomjon has been baking the national bread “lepeshka”. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes lepeshka and other bread so people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. All the input materials like flour, salt, and yeast is purchased in the local market. Now Islomjon requests 2500 Somoni (750 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. The loan shall be spent for purchasing flour, and coal for baking the “lepeshka”. Islomjon deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchasing flour for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en: K. Moses is a client of Pearl Microfinance in Lugazi. He has a salon in which he has 6 years of experience. He is 26 years of age and married with one school-going child. He also cares for his relatives in the village. He has been a member of his lending group for two and a half years. He got his capital to start up his own salon from his first salary as an employee in a friend's salon until time came for him to do his own. The loans have helped him to buy more appliances for his salon, and now he seeks another loan to be able to buy a hair shaving machine and two comfortable chairs for his customers for more comfortable men's and women’s hair cuts.

loans.use: To buy a hair shaving machine and two comfortable chairs for his barber shop.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en: H. Parvina, 27, is married and has three children. She has many years' experience driving a taxi, which she does for a living. Her husband also works as a taxi driver. Money from the taxi driving is the principal source of income for the family. Parvina is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300 USD) to make repairs on her car with which she earns the money to put food on their table. Parvina thanks everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan within 12 months in a timely manner. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: Repairing the car

loans.name: Yawavi M.

texts.fr:
Madame MENSAH est née le 08 septembre 1966 à Notsè, une localité au sud du Togo. Elle est divorcée de son époux TOGBEDJI Komi qui est un mécanicien et a quatre (04) enfants à sa charge. Elle a pour activité la restauration dans le quartier  d’Agoè Assiyéyé. 
Madame MENSAH n’a jamais obtenu de prêt à WAGES, elle voudrait faire prospérer son commerce et sollicite ce premier crédit pour pouvoir acheter 5 sacs de riz et 18 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Ms. MENSAH was born on September 8, 1966 in Notsè, a town in southern Togo. She is divorced from her spouse Komi TOGBEDJI, a mechanic, and has four children to look after. Her work involves catering in the Agoè Assiyéyé district. She has never been a recipient of a WAGES loan. She would like to make her business prosperous and is requesting this initial loan to buy 5 sacks of rice and 18 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and rice for catering

loans.name: Rukhsora

texts.en: Rukhsora is a responsible and loving mother who is always thinking of the well-being and security of her children. Rukhsora works diligently caring for cows at a facility in her home, which she then sells at various fairs in the area. She shows the same dedication to the small creatures that she shows to her small children, and, in a short amount of time, they have provided her with excellent earnings. She is eager to increase the capacity of her animal care facilities to accommodate a greater number of animals. With your strong support, she will be able to achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Grace Divine Group

texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates at seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Lucie T. was born on March 25, 1967. Lucie is married to Benédictus Akue and they have two children, ages 12 and 14, both of whom are in school. Lucie is part of Divine Grace along with Clarisse R..

13 years ago, Lucie began selling onions wholesale; she also sells assorted items at Dantokpa Market. Due to recent construction at Dantokpa, Lucie has had to relocate to a less lucrative location. Should her business return when she goes back to Dantokpa, Lucie would like to add peppers, garlic, and ginger to her wares. With her current loan, she will buy onions in large quantity at a lower price.

Clarisse R. was born on August 9, 1964. Clarisse has four children, aged 8, 12, 16, and 28. They are all educated. Clarisse sells delicious Béninois food such as komé (traditional corn dish), fresh fish, peppers, and igname (a hard potato-like vegetable). Clarisse's pots are filled with steaming meals – frying ignames, pepper spread, skinny noodles, fried bananas, and fish. Around Clarisse, gather her friends and family, helping serve, and perhaps angling for a free meal.

Clarisse started her business six years ago with capital of about $90.00 USD. Clarisse began by selling apples, but diversified when she realized she could not get by on apples alone. Currently, she is trying to build up a store of plastic bowels and cooking flatware so she can sell these products too.

loans.use: Purchase large bags of onions

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.en: N. Makhfirat is a 55 year old woman, married with 3 children. The diligent search for a source of additional income has been a permanent and difficult task for Makhfirat. After trying her luck at a variety of occupations, she decided to work in the area of livestock. She started this business 10 years ago with the support of her husband. Now Makhfirat has experimented and acquired the necessary knowledge regarding this activity. She would like to expand her activity by purchasing more cattle so she can increase her earnings and continue to improve her family’s quality of life. Makhfirat is requesting a loan of 1700 Somoni ($500 US Dollars). She has agreed to repay this loan within 12 months. She appeals to your good hearts in her request to make her dreams become reality.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: N. Sarah is 42 years old and a member of Pearl Microfinance in Lugazi. She has 7 children who are all in school and she cares for 3 more relatives. Sarah is a farmer. She also buys produce from other farmers, especially matooke, cassava, maize, and beans. She has been in this business for 8 years and ha been member of her lending group for 10 years. Her first loan helped her start to buy produce from fellow farmers. As a result, she has been able to construct a residential home as well as pay the school fees for her children. Sarah needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for her customers.

loans.use: To buy more produce for her customers.

loans.name: Mathilde

texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Mathilde B. is divorced, but cares for the three children of her deceased sister. Her nieces and nephews are 3, 10, and 15 years old. Mathilde started out selling fabrics 16 years ago, and three years ago switched to selling drinks. She provides schooling for her children with the money she makes.

Mathilde buys beer, water, and soda cheaply from Béninois storehouses at Dantokpa Market in Lomé, Togo. Mathilde can purchase there at a 60 to 80 cent discount. Mathilde has four constant clients at Sekandji, a nearby market. She sells all her drink products within a few days and has to restock.

Mathilde has simple, but ambitious plans for her business. She would like to have a large depot in the future where she can stock all her goods and make a greater profit.

loans.use: Purchase of various drinks

loans.name: Eseza's Group

texts.en: Eseza K. is a member of Pearl Microfinance in Lugazi, Uganda. Eseza has her own business selling fresh food, like matooke, for the last 10 years. Before her current business, she was a coffee farmer making local brew.  She is 50 years old, married with one child, and cares for 7 dependents, including a few grandchildren. She is grateful for the loans because she now owns a home, her dependents are happy, and her general standard of living has improved since joining her lending group a year and a half ago. Eseza needs a loan to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: Eseza needs a loan to buy more produce to sell.

loans.name: Latifatou

texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates at seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Latifatou B. was born on March 20, 1974. Latifatou has two children; Moise, 15, and Jusieu, 9, both in school. Latifatou has sold bags of corn and charcoal in bulk for the past 15 years. She sells out of her room on the second floor of her apartment building.

Latifatou is often gone for 5-10 days at a time buying her goods cheaply in the north of Bénin. Her clients come from all over Cotonou and as far as Ganvié to buy her goods.

With this loan, Latifatou will build up her store and continue to furnish corn and charcoal to her eager clients. This is Latifatou's fourth Kiva loan.

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of corn and charcoal

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates at seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Claudine A. is married to Djakpo Dossou and has four children, Céleste, 8, Claudiette, 11, Alexandrine, 17, and Armane, 19. Her three youngest children are in school.

Claudine has three businesses: she sells juice, fabric, and she caters for special occasions. Juices are Claudine's speciality, especially bissap (hibiscus flower tea) and lemon juice. Her sales of juice rise exponentially during the dry season. Claudine also sells bags of sugar and blocks of ice.

Claudine has spent the past 10 years selling these products and has been receiving loans since 2005. Her eventual goal is to buy a generator to keep her drinks cold when the electricity cuts off, which it does frequently in Cotonou, and also to find a full-time desk job.

loans.use: Purchase of bags of sugar, food coloring, and bissap (hibiscus flower tea)

loans.name: Robert's Group

texts.en: G. Robert is a member of Kwewayo Namukozi Women’s Group in Mityana. He is 32 years of age and married with 3 children and he cares for 1 adopted daughter. He has a shop from which he has been selling sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, and many other things for 3 years now. He has been with his lending group for a year and a half and he has a dream of transforming his business into a wholesale shop. He needs a new loan to help with restocking his shop to make more profits.

loans.use: Robert needs a new loan to help with restocking his shop.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Hello from Angelique U. from Western province of Rwanda! This entrepreneur is 31 years old and has four children. Angelique started her business with a small shop where she sold only milk, bread, and cake, but with our loans, her business has grown, as you can see from her business pictures. 

This entrepreneur is requesting for a loan of 500,000 Frw to increase her working capital and enable her to raise money to pay for her children’s school fees next year. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is married. She owns a retail business and sells clothing, shoes, small home appliances, etc. She lives in Zaporozhye City, but her business is in the neighboring villages. She goes out each day to one or a few villages and sells her goods. She has almost no competition, because there are no markets in the villages. Her monthly income is 2,000 UAH, and her working capital is 15,000 UAH.

Vera is a hard-working person. She has been in this business for 10 years already. During this time she has built a good client base and has many repeat clients. Often she brings things that her clients order from the city.

Very would like to get a loan of 6,500 UAH to purchase more inventory. She needs to buy winter clothing and boots to sell. She hopes she can sell more during the coming Christmas and New Year season.

loans.use: To purchase winter inventory of clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Njini

texts.en:
E. was born in the year 1971 and is married with three children, who are all below 15 years of age. The family is living in a house with one bedroom and one sitting room. The death of her mother, who was in ill health, and her dropping out of school made life very difficult for her, until the year 2007 in which she saw GHAPE (the lender) as a source of relief. In that same year, she obtained a loan of 40,000FRS, and the repayment was successful.

Given a loan, she intends to buy bananas and plantains for 10,000 FRS, dried groundnuts for 50,000FRS, firewood for 25000FRS, pear avocados for 25000FRS, and then 10,000FRS will be used for transportation. Her loan repayment will start from the day the loan is disbursed.

She is convinced the business will succeed because she has experience , her prices are moderate and also she has a good business site. This business activity will help her community by reducing their distance to the market. Also she will help to supply food to her community.

E. plans to use the profit from her business to complete her building project in her village (kom). Also she will pay school fees for her children and clothe herself and her family. And she'll give good medical attention to her family.

She prefers loans from GHAPE to other organizations because GHAPE is trustworthy, the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient, and proper follow-up is been done to ensure the loan is properly used.

loans.use: Buying and selling of bananas, plantains, avocados, and more.

loans.name: Ruth Kato Group

texts.en:
K. Ruth is 43 years old and married with 6 children, all school-going. She has a retail business of selling produce that she harvests from her farm as well as buying from fellow farmers in instances where she does not have enough for her customers. As a result, Ruth has been able to pay school fees for her children as well as improve her home by buying household items. Plus she buys animals that she keeps at her home basically for sale when they are mature. Ruth seeks a loan to be able to buy more produce for sale. 

She is a member of the Kwewayo Namukozi lending group in Mityana, and they are applying for a group loan. The other women will use the loan for similar purposes.

loans.use: Ruth seeks a loan to be able to buy more produce for sale.

loans.name: Tusk

texts.en:
J. was born the year 1959, and is happily married with eight children, three below 15 years. Being a very hard-working man with a large family, he has faced some challenges in life such as ill health, poor harvests, and school drop out because of inadequate finance, and he is not able to pay for his children's school fees. Because of all these challenges, J. saw GHAPE as a source of relief in the year 2007. In this same year J. received his first loan of 40,000frs, and the repayment was done promptly. 

Given a loan of 200,000FRS, he plans to buy one load of firewood for 70,000FRS, wood for timber for 80,000FRS, and transportation for the wood and timber costing 50,000FRS. He will start repayment from the day of disbursement. The success of the business is guaranteed because he has experience in the business and he has a ready market for the goods. He plans to use the profit from the business to pay school fees fore his children, give good medical attention to his family and also good food to his family. J. prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE, and he has been thought how to manage the loan in GHAPE, and the method of repayment is comfortable.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients, and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying and selling of firewood.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella T., a 28-year-old trader, is divorced and has four children. Currently, three of the children are in school. Stella is a very resourceful mother whose hard work brings livelihood to her children. She lives with her children in Kasoa, a suburb of Accra, where she also has her business. She supports her family and provides for her children by selling glasses and ladies slippers. She balances her wares on her head, and walks to the doorsteps of her loyal customers. 

With this loan, Stella wants to purchase more glasses and slippers to increase her inventory. She believes the loan will help her save for her children’s education and rent a store for her trade. 

She is member of the group called the Boldness Trust Group. Members of this group agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days, and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of glasses and slippers.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort S. is 35 years old. She is a widow and has three children. Two of her kids are still in school, one has not started school. She owns and operates grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, pastries which she prepares by herself, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. in her neighborhood. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. S. belongs to the Trust group called Ephesians Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and boxes of biscuit etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia D. is thirty nine years old. She is married with five children, two of them have successfully completed high school and the other three are still in school. Lydia enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her children. She owns and operates a grocery store and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. However, she is constrained by low capital to make meaningful progress. She requests this loan to purchase supplies for her store in order to increase profits. She believes that together with her good customer relation skills, the loan will enable her to realize her dreams. She is a member of the community group called Ephesians Trust Group. In her group, members guarantee and assist one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days. Her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her store

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has one grown-up son. She sells men's underwear and women’s tights. Her kiosk is located at one of the city markets at a very good location that attracts many clients. Good pricing attracts clients too.

Tatyana has been in this business for 5 years. She is a very nice and outgoing person. She loves her business and treats the clients well. She has many repeat clients. Her monthly income is 2,500 UAH, and her working capital is 20,000 UAH.

Tatyana would like to get a loan of 3,000 UAH to purchase gift underwear sets to sell. She believes that the Christmas and New Year season is a good time to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase gift setsof underwear to sell

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto tiene 23 años, es conviviente, tiene una hija, y por el momento está viviendo en la casa de sus suegros. Desde muy niño ha trabajado en la agricultura, su padre falleció cuando él tenia 13 años, desde entonces, apoya a su madre en la chacra, hace poco inició su propia familia, entonces, trabaja unos días para su madre y los otros días en su casa. Lo más gratificante para él son los dias de feria, porque puede vender la papa que produce y el dinero vuelve a sus manos, para con ello vuelva a sembrar, el resto de días se dedica al cultivo, cosecha y selección de la papa. Su deseo es alquilar un puesto en el mercado mayorista, dice que le sería más rentable, porque ganaría directamente, sin revendedores, porque cuando vende al por mayor los mayoristas le pagan lo que quieren y no el precio de acuerdo al mercado. Este ya es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado pagará el adelanto por el alquiler de un puesto, y con la otra parte comprará abono que necesita para sus chacras de papa.
texts.en:
Alberto, 23, is partnered and has a daughter. For now, he's living with his in-laws. He's worked in farming since he was a boy. His father died when he was 13 and he's supported his mother since by working in the fields. Since starting his own family, he works for his mother part of the time and for his own family part of the time. The happiest days for him are market days because he can sell the potatoes that he grows and collect the money that he's earned. He then returns to plant again. The rest of his time is spent growing, harvesting and sorting potatoes. He would like to rent a space in the main market. He says that it would be very profitable because he would sell directly, without resellers. Wholesalers pay what they want rather than the prices agreed on in the market. This is Alberto's ninth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and he's repaid all of the loans on time. With this loan, he will pay in advance for a market space and buy fertilizer that he needs for his potato fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Market stall rental and fertilizer for farming business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. is 49 years old. She is married and has five kids. Currently three of them are in school. Through hard work, Veronica has provided support for two kids to complete senior high school. She is a food vendor who has sold kenkey in her neighborhood for the past ten years. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grain, cooked and taken with hot pepper, gravy stew or any kind of soup and fried fish or meat. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw ingredients like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. As a part of her business expansion, Veronica has added cooked rice and stew to her product line. When asked, she said most of her customers requested the rice so she saw it as an opportunity. She hopes to raise more income to support her children in school. She belongs to the community group called Boldness Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and provide assistance to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro es casado, tiene 43 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, pero con ellos sólo viven dos de ellos. El trabaja en la municipalidad de su localidad en el sector administrativo desde hace más de 20 años, pero ese sueldo no le es suficiente para los gastos que tiene en la educación de sus hijos, por ello que hace como 2 años atrás se compró un motocarro para hacer taxi después de salir de su trabajo, en horas de la noche, desde 6.00pm hasta las 12.00pm. Alejandro está muy contento con su trabajo adicional, lo que le permite llevar una vida decorosa y darles educación a sus hijos. Las dificultades se presentan cuando se malogra su motocarro. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y no ha tenido problemas de morosidad. Con el dinero solicitado cambiará las llantas de su motocarro, para que pueda seguir haciendo taxi de forma adecuada.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 43, is married and has three children, only two of whom still live at home. He has worked as an administrator for the city where he lives for more than 20 years but his salary there isn't enough to pay for his children's schooling. He bought a "motocarro" 2 years ago to set up a taxi business that he operates after work from 6pm to midnight. Alejandro is happy with his extra job because it allows him to lead a decent life and provide for his children's education. Difficulties arise, though, when the motocarro breaks down. This is Alejandro's fifth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and he's always repaid past loans on time. With this loan, he will change the tires on his motocarro so that he can continue operating his taxi business in the proper way.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change tires on motocarro.

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.es: Ambrosia, de 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales viven con ella 3 de ellos. Sus padres era agricultores, cuando ella se casó, también empezó a sembrar varias hectáreas de papa, pero debido a que perdió sus cosechas por falta de lluvia y la helada, le dio un giro a su actividad económica, desde entonces se convirtió en una negociante de carnes R., en un inicio vendía como ambulante, después compró un puesto en el mercado, con lo que está mucho más tranquila. Este negocio le agrada mucho, y sobre todo le es más rentable que la agricultura. Mientras que ella se dedica a la venta en su puesto, su esposo sale de casa a las 4.00am rumbo a las zonas más altas para comprar animales para la venta de carne, de ese modo ganan un poco más. Este es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, es muy puntual en sus pagos, y está muy agradecida con la ayuda que hasta ahora le ha brindado su IMF, porque dice que a estas alturas, no tendría su negocio. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ganado, y así podrá obtener la carne cuando la necesite.
texts.en:
Ambrosia, 50, is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom still live with her. Her parents were farmers and when she married, she also grew a few hectares of potatoes. When a crop failed because of heavy rains and frost, she decided to quit farming and sell meat instead. At first, she worked as a street vendor; later, she bought a market stall, a much calmer endeavor. She's pleased with the business, above all because it's more profitable than farming. Ambrosia's husband leaves the house at 4:00 am to buy farm animals that can be butchered for meat while she goes to work selling in the market. This is her ninth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and she's been very punctual in repaying the loans. She's grateful for the help that she's received up to now from IMF because she says she wouldn't have her business without it. The loan will be used to buy livestock so that they can get meat for the business when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock for meat business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice T. is 42 years old and a mother with three kids. Two of them are in school now and the youngest has not started school. She has been selling grocery products for five years on a table in her neighborhood, to support her family. She says business is doing well, and she therefore wants to use the loan to buy more products to increase her inventory. Beatrice believes the loan would help her increase her savings towards the welfare of her two children who are in school now. She is a member of the group called Boldness. Members in the group agree in unison to guarantee for each other to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting. Her child is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like tins of fish and tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, vegetable oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Loh

texts.en:
M. is married with six children (two of whom are below fifteen) and lives in Sisia III, Nkwen, a quarter in Bamenda, Cameroon. M. runs a small tailoring workshop with her husband in the Nkwen market. With this loan, she plans to buy more material for sewing. She also plans to do marking (embroidery) of dresses and clothing. Her business plan shows she will invest 10,000 CFA (approximately $20 USD) of her own savings as well.  
 
This will be M.'s third loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2006. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location (right on the main road), the quality of her products, and her reasonable prices. She buys in bulk which causes the price to be minimal and sews things herself with the help of her husband. She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales. 
 
Part of the profits from this loan will be used for the school fees of M.'s children. And the other part will be used for medication and food for her large family. M. does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments as they are quite small repayments, every two weeks.  

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying of material, sewing, and marking (embroidery) supplies

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is a mother of two kids; one is currently in school. She is a 32-year-old trader. She trades in lace and material. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She also sells shirts and skirts. For lack of adequate working capital, Beatrice buys few extras of lace materials and sells through hawking. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk lace materials and textiles. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with a quality education. 

Beatrice belongs to the community group called Ephesians Trust group. The group members guarantee a loan through a repayment pledge and support one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase bulk lace materials and textiles to resell

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es: Bacilia tiene 38 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos que estudian, dos de ellos el nivel primario y el mayor se está estudiando para postular a la universidad. En su pueblo, todos sin excepción se dedican a la agricultura, a ella le gustaba dedicarse a la venta de ropa, pero su realidad cambió, ahora que tiene hijos y su esposo es agricultor, él siembra papa y demás productos, a ella no le gustaba sembrar papa porque se requería de mucha inversión y el precio en el mercado no era gratificante. Pero nos dice que en esta temporada, al menos, ha bajado el precio de los fertilizantes de 215 a 185 soles, y espera que se mantengan a ese precio, para que  recompense su inversión. Esta familia tiene dificultad en la siembra de sus chacras por falta de dinero, ya que no pudieron abonar su otra chacra y no va a producir como se esperaba. Es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, nos comenta con sinceridad que sólo en una oportunidad se retrazó con un pago, pero generalmente, luego de varios prestamos, han puesto la confianza en ella, y no ha defraudado a su IMF. Ahora comprará fertilizantes para que pueda abonar sus chacras de papa, con la ilusión de que en la campaña de mayo puedan cosechar satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Bacilia is 38 years old with three children--two are in primary school and the eldest is studying to get into university. In her town, everyone works in agriculture. She wanted to sell clothing, but her circumstances have changed, now that she has children and a husband who's a farmer. He plants potatoes and other produce, but she didn't want to plant potatoes because it requires such a large investment and the market price is not satisfactory. But this season, at least, the price of fertilizers has fallen from 215 to 185 soles, and she hopes the price will hold steady so she can recoup her investment. The family has faced difficulties planting their fields because they didn't have enough money to fertilize both of them, so one is not as productive as they'd hoped. This is Bacilia's seventh loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she tells us with sincerity that she has only delayed in making one payment, but after various loans the microfinance institution has regained its confidence in her, and she has not let them down. Now she will buy fertilizer that will enable her to fertilize the potato field, with the hope that May will bring a satisfactory harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa F. is 28 years old and married with two children. One child is in school and the other has not started school.  Yaa Fosusaa is very grateful to Sinapi for giving her loan to start her trade.  She used a previous loan from Sinapi to start selling pastries to children at school and to other workers in her town. This business enabled her to save money to help support her husband in paying the children’s school fees. 

Yaa F. wants to add to her pastries business by selling coffee and Milo at breakfast which she says customers are asking for. She therefore wants to use this loan to buy more bags of flour, margarine, coffee cups, cartons of Milo and coffee to expand her operation. 

Yaa F. is a member of the group called Ephesians Trust Group. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay each other's loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting with her youngest child.

loans.use: To buy more bags of flour, margarine, coffee cups, carton of milo and coffee

loans.name: Anatolyi

texts.en:
Anatolyi is married and has one grown up daughter. He co-owns a little 24-hour food store with a monthly turn-over of 120,000 UAH.

Anatolyi has been in this business for 8 years since  friend of his suggested Anatolyi to get involved in this business and become a partner. Anagolyi agreed. He understands his clients' needs well and adjusts his stock accordingly.

Anatolyi would like to get a seasonal loan of 3,000 UAH to purchase more goods. He hopes to increase his sales and offer more product variety to his clients during the Christmas and New Year season.

loans.use: to purchase more goods

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 28 años, ella y su pareja viven juntos y están todavía en preparativos para casarse, tienen dos hijos. Se comprometió muy jovencita, desde entonces, con su esposo se dedicaron de lleno a la agricultura, que se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos, se han organizados y delegado funciones cada uno. Trabajan en la chacra de lunes a miércoles, los días de feria ella baja a la ciudad llevando sus productos para venderlos en el mercado, luego el viernes y sábado trabaja en la chacra y termina el domingo, vendiendo su producción de papa en el mercado de la ciudad, mientras que su esposo se dedica íntegramente al cultivo y cuidado del campo. Para ellos la agricultura le es rentable ahora, porque ella misma comercializa sus productos, en años pasados vendía a los mayoristas y ganaban muy poco. Este es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y es muy responsable en sus pagos. Este dinero será invertido en la compra de 6 sacos de fertilizantes, ya que la tierra necesita de abono, sin ello no produce, nos dice sonriente.
texts.en:
Betty is 28 years old and lives with her fiancé, with whom she has two children. She was engaged at a very young age, and since then has worked with her fiancé in agriculture. This has become their sole source of income, and they each have a specific function. They both work in the field from Monday through Wednesday. On her day off, Betty goes down to the city to sell their products in the market. Fridays and Saturdays, she works in the field and finishes Sunday, selling her potatoes in the city market while her fiancé tends the land. Now, agriculture is profitable for them because Betty sells the produce herself; in past years they would sell to wholesalers and earn very little. This is her seventh loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very responsible with her payments. This money will be used for the purchase of six bags of fertilizer, without which, she says with a smile, the land doesn't work.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda A. is 27 years old. She is married with two children. Currently one of her kids is in school and the other has not yet started school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, and other sundries in the local market. She also sells charcoal to provide her with extra income to support her kids in school. She wants to use the loan to expand her business by buying bulk supplies of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc. Patricia hopes the expanded business will increase her income and enable her to provide a quality education for her children. She belongs to the community group called Ephesians Trust Group. The group members guarantee each others loans through a repayment pledge to assist one another in loan repayment. She does not sell on group meeting days.  Her picture was taken at a group meeting with her youngest child.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders etc.

loans.name: Deyci

texts.es: Deicy tiene 33 años, es casada, tiene un hijo, viven en una casa alquilada. Ante de de casarse, junto a su madre se dedicaban a la compra y venta de fruta, al por mayor y menor, pero desde hace 6 años está trabajando en la municipalidad de su localidad, entonces de lunes a viernes su madre está a cargo del negocio, y los sábados y domingos venden juntas, además todas las noches, ambas hacen el balance respectivo de sus ventas. Deyci es una mujer de negocio, por lo que considera tener varios ingresos económicos en diferentes conceptos, es por ello, que a pesar de que ahora tiene un trabajo estable, no deja la venta de fruta, porque es muy rentable, ya que en el pasado se sostenía solo de esas ganancias. Lo que lamenta es que sabe que no puede cargar a su madre con toda la responsabilidad, porque hay días que la nota muy cansada, ya que no tiene las mismas fuerzas que cuando era más joven. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y paga muy puntual sus cuotas. El dinero solicitado le servirá para incrementar y almacenarse de frutas, así podrá enviar una buena cantidad para venderse en la ciudad de Lima, donde ganará mucho más.
texts.en:
Deyci is 33 yars old, married, has a son, and lives in a rented house. Since before she was married she has been buying and selling fruit at wholesale and retail with her mother. For the past 6 years she has been working in the municipality of her area, so Monday through Friday her mother is in charge of the business and on Saturdays and Sundays they sell together. Additionally, every night they both do the accounting for their sales. Deyci is a business woman who has various sources of income from different businesses. In spite of having a stable job she has not stopped selling fruit because it is very profitable, and in the past she was able to support herself solely from these earnings. She knows that she cannot ask her mother to be fully responsible for the business because there are days that she sees her mother is very tired because she doesn’t have the same energy today as when she was younger. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is punctual with her payments. The money will be used to increase and stock fruit so that she will be able to send a good quantity to sell in Lima city, where she will earn much more money.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits to increase her stock of fruit

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Married with a child who is currently in school, Grace is 27 years old. Grace supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing. Selling used clothing has a very big market in Ghana, as brand-new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Grace has been in this business for the past 3 years. She makes her sales by ‘hawking’, which is door-to-door sales. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used things to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s future and also to rent a store to trade.

She is member of the group called Ephesians Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales, viven con ella 3 de ellos. Desde muy joven trabajó en la chacra, para poder mantener y educar a sus hijos  conjuntamente con su esposo, en esos tiempos negociaban las frutas que cosechaban en su misma chacra. Pero hace 10 años se propuso comprar fruta y junto a sus productos, enviar por grandes cantidades al mercado mayorista de la capital. A Elena le agrada mucho la venta y sobre todo ahora que tiene un mercado estable al cual abastecer, está feliz, y lo importante es que le genera ganancias considerables que le permiten llevar una vida decorosa, por el momento no tiene dificultades en su negocio, solo que de vez en cuando el precio cotizado baja, y esto afectan sus ganancias. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y no tiene problemas en pagar todas sus cuotas de forma puntual. Con el dinero solicitado se abastecerá de más frutos cítricos, ya que en la capital es tiempo de verano, por ello quiere invertir en la compra de más frutas.
texts.en:
Elena is 45 years old, married, and has 8 children, of whom 3 still live at home. Since she was very young she has worked on the farm in order to support and educate her children along with her husband. Today they have a fruit business using fruit they have grown on their farm. 10 years ago she proposed selling fruit and fruit products, sending large quantities to the wholesale market in the capital. Elena enjoys sales very much and above all now that she has a stable market to supply to, she is happy, and what is important is that this business generates considerable income which enables her to have a respectable life. For the moment she does not have any difficulties with her business, only every now and then when the prices lower does this affect her earnings. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Primsa, and she doesn’t have any problems paying her payments punctually. With the money she will stock citrus fruits, as in the capital it is summer, so she wants to invest in buying more fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of fruits to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort Y. is a mother of two kids who are currently in school. She is 34 year old trader. She trades in lace materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations.  For lack of adequate working capital, Comfort buys few stocks of lace materials and sells through hawking. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk of lace materials and textile clothes. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education. Comfort belongs to the community group called Ephesians Trust group. The group members guarantee a loan through repayment pledge and support one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of lace materials and textile

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es: Enriqueta tiene 40 años, es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos, D. los cuales, viven con elL. 2 D. ellos. DesD. muy joven le ha dedicado mucha entrega a sus chacras, por ello no siente dificultad alguna al tener que ir a trabajar en el campo, se levanta a eso D. las 4.00am para preparar los desayunos y el almuerzo D. sus hijos que tiene que ir al colegio, después D. dar alimento a sus vacas, cerca D. las 11.00am, lleva el almuerzo a su esposo en L. chacra. Para esta familia, L. agricultura es su único ingreso económico, a Enriqueta le agrada cultivar sus tierras y cuidar D. su ganado, que a veces le ocasionan problemas por irse a comer los cultivos D. los vecinos. Este es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Con L. cantidad solicitada va a comprar abono y veneno para fumigar las hojas para que tengan buen follaje, ya que L. papa depenD. D. L. hoja, para un buen fruto.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is 40 years old, married, with 4 children of whom 2 still live at home. Since she was young she has worked on the farm, and she doesn’t find it difficult to work in the field. She gets up at 4:00 AM to prepare breakfast and lunch for her children who go to school, then she feeds her cows. Around 11:00 AM she takes lunch to her husband on the farm. For this family agriculture is its only source of income. Enriqueta enjoys farming her land. This is her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been punctual in her payments. With the money she is going to buy fertilizer and pesticiD. to fumigate the leaves so that she gets good foliage, as the potato plant depends on its leaf in order to generate good fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crops

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika tiene 27 años, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, está viviendo en la casa de sus suegros y una vez que esté lista su casa se mudarán. Cuando era pequeña se dedicaba a pastar el ganado de su madre, después de más joven decidió sembrar papa y arvejas para sus propios ingresos, luego conoció a su pareja e inició su familia. Desde entonces ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, y tienen metas de sembrar no solo en la sierra, sino también en la costa, debido a que ha notado que a sus familiares que siembran en otros lugares les va bien. Erika considera que la agricultura siempre es un riego, se puede perder o ganar, debido al clima, a los precios del mercado, etc., por ello quiere sembrar en varios lugares, y ella nos dice que sin dinero no se puede sembrar nada. Es su 7mo  préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y es muy puntual en sus pagos. Esta vez, con el dinero solicitado, va a comprar 6 sacos de fertilizantes para abonar su chacra, calcula que este préstamo cubrirá toda esa inversión, y está muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Erika is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives with her husband’s parents and when their house is ready they will move into it. When she was little she took care of her mother’s livestock. While still young she decided to grow potatoes and peas to generate her own income. Then she met her husband and started a family. Since then she and her husband have been farmers, and they have goals of growing not only in the mountains, but also on the coast, as she has noted that her friends who grow crops in both locations do very well. Erika believes that farming is always is risk, you can lose or win, depending on the weather, the market prices, etc. so she wants to grow crops in various locations and she tell us that without money she will not be able to plant anything. This is her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been punctual in her payments. With the money she is going to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer for her farm, and she calculates that this loan will cover this investment. She is very grateful for this opportunity provided to her.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married with three sons. Before Sergey started his business, he used to be a hired employee. Then he lost his job and was forced to find another source of income for the family with three little kids. His mother encouraged him to start a business selling children’s and men’s clothing items two years ago. Sergey is very consistent and balanced, and he has a good sense of management. That’s why he has succeeded to manage all loans without any delinquencies.

Sergey is applying for a loan to get sufficient capital to increase his inventory and gain extra profits. It will not only help him have enough to maintain his family and cover the increasing demand this Christmas season, but also stimulate business development and help him reinforce his trade activities, providing necessary resources for his small business. Sergey has recently faced some serious problems with his competitors. Some of them even tried to set his vending kiosk on fire. Investigators couldn’t prove they were the arsonists and thus couldn’t sue the suspects in court. Despite all these challenges Sergey remained committed to the success of his business and is hoping to see all his dreams come true one day.

This is a short-term loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo se separó de su esposa hace 5 años atrás, tiene 54 años, tiene 5 hijos, en este momento vive solo. Para él más que herramientas de trabajo, las palas y lampas, son sus elementos de diversión, creció en el ambiente de la agricultura, sus padres sembraban en grandes cantidades y él heredo este oficio. Cuando aún estaba con su esposa e hijos, todos sembraba en grandes cantidades, pero como ahora se quedó solo ha sembrado 1y ½  hectáreas de papa y otros productos, debido a ello ya no esta con mucha frecuencia en la chacra, solo cuando requiere de limpieza y en tiempo de cosecha. Entonces, se encuentra con mayor frecuencia en su casa o viaja a visitar a sus hijos que están en la ciudad, esta vez no le alcanzó el dinero para sembrar en más terreno. Es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y hasta el momento ha pagando sin mora sus cuotas. Con la cantidad solicitada comprará fertilizantes de nitrato y potasio, unas 5 bolsas, o que considera le costará, aproximadamente, entre 1000 a 1200 soles.
texts.en:
Guillermo separated from his wife 5 years ago. He is 54 years old, has 5 children, and at the moment lives alone. For him, beyond the tools of his work such as shovels are the enjoyable aspects of farming such as growing up on a farm. His parents used to grow large quantities and he has continued in this family profession. When he was still with his wife and children, they all planted large quantities, but now as he is alone he has only planted 1 ½ hectares of potato and other products, and he is not on the farm as much now, only when he needs to prepare the land and at the time of harvest. So, he finds himself at home with greater frequency now or traveling to visit his children who live in the city. This time he didn’t have enough money to plant more of his land. This is his 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he has made his payments promptly. With the money he will buy 5 bags of nitrate and potassium fertilizer, which he estimates will cost him approximately between 1000 to 1200 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Nanga

texts.en:
M. is a very hard-working woman with five children. Since childhood, she has faced many obstacles in life because her parents were poor and could not send her to school after class six of primary school. Instead she had to go to work on the family farm and help to pay for the education of her younger sibling. She cannot read and write . Despite these limitations, she has set out to overcome poverty and provide her children with the education she did not have. She also hopes someday to go back to school herself.

With these goals in mind, M. joined GHAPE one year ago. So determined was she with her previous loan, which she used to buy land, that she has been able to build a house for herself and her children.

Given a loan, she plans to buy chicks, fowl feed, feeders, medication for fowls and seedlings for her farm. She is contributing 100,000frs CFA from her personal savings to the success of this her project. She plans to repay her loan in 12 months from the date of disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks, fowl feed, feeders and seedlings

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 39 años. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, años atrás, junto a su esposo, sembraba papa en grandes cantidades, tanto en la costa como en la sierra, hasta que juntaron dinero y lograron comprarse un carro para transportar sus productos. Pero luego vinieron temporadas malas donde su producción no maduró por motivo de los insectos o las lluvias afectaban sus sembríos y los perdían, y por último el incremento del precio de los fertilizantes, por ello que este año ha sembrado muy poco. Si está dedicando a criar vacunos, y ya tiene buen número, considera que le es mucho más rentable que la chacra, solo que tiene que sembrar avena en grades cantidades para el alimento de sus animales, y con lo que ya tiene, está implementada para largo tiempo, además, en el mercado de su zona, vende a diario la leche que producen sus vacas y los quesos que ella elabora. Es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y es una clienta que paga de forma puntual sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado va comprar vacunos de raza, para que pueda aprovechar en mayor cantidad la leche, y por ende producir en mayor cantidad quesos.
texts.en:
Isabel is 39-years-old. She has always worked in agriculture. Years ago, together with her husband, she grew potatoes in large quantities on the coast and in the mountains. When they had enough money saved up, they bought a car to transport their products. But then came some bad times when their production didn't mature because of insects, or the rains affected their plantings and they lost them. Most recently, they have had to deal with the increase in the price of fertilizers, so this year they have grown very little. She also is raising cattle, and she already has a good number of them. She considers them more profitable than growing crops. She only has to grow oats in large quantities to feed the animals, and with what she has, she has enough to last a long time. Also, in the market in her area, she sells the milk that her cattle produce daily and cheese that she makes. This is her seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is a client who pays back her loans in a punctual manner. With the money she is requesting, she is going to purchase cattle of a good breed, so she can capitalize on the larger quantity of milk they will produce, and therefore make a larger quantity of cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle of a good breed so they will produce more milk

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en:
Yaroslav sells household items, such as dishware, disposable goods and plastic bags, in one of the local markets of his home town of Zaporozhye. Yaroslav has been running this business for 10 years. Presently, his turnover capital is over 25,000 Grivnas. His monthly income is about 8,000 Grivnas. 

Yaroslav is married. His wife is actively helping him with his business, which is the main source of income for their family. They work hard to meet their family's needs. Not long ago, Yaroslav was in a car accident. However, he recovered and his business remained stable and is running smooth today. 

Yaroslav believes financial assistance will support him in his endeavors. He is determined to work on his entrepreneurial dreams to make them a reality. He understands that real success and wealth take time. 

He is seeking a 3,000 Grivna loan hoping to generate more profit as he increases his sale rates. This is a short-term,  seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married with a three-year-old son. He used to work as a welder. However, working conditions we horrible and Mykola decided to try his luck with his own business instead. This is how he launched his startup and became a taxi driver. Today he owns a van and provides transportation services throughout Ukraine. Moreover, he owns a car which he leases. The business is the only source of income for his family of three. Mykola works very hard, sometimes without days off or vacation, in order to bring in enough income. He uses a walkie-talkie to help him facilitate his work and get right to a pick-up a lot faster.

Mykola has been in this business for 3 years. His determination and strong will to succeed have helped him keep his business stable and sustainable and have promoted its expansion. Mykola has received and paid back all loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Currently, his daily income is about 250-280 Grivnas. Mukola would like to get a loan for 5,000 Grivnas to do some repair work on the body of his vehicle. One of his long-term plans is to eventually pay back the loan for his second vehicle. We are confident that the modesty, diligence and responsibility that have helped Mykola develop his venture and gain a good reputation among other taxi drivers will help him promptly repay this loan and allow him to succeed in his business endeavors.

loans.use: To do car repairs

loans.name: Sergyi

texts.en:
Sergyi is married with a 4-year-old daughter. The family lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. Sergyi rents a car and offers transportation services. Moreover, he offers funeral services as he drives a hearse, too. His business is the only source of income for the family. Sergyi usually has many passengers. He has been in this business for 10 years. Currently, his daily profit is about 250 Grivnas.  

Sergyi realizes his bus needs maintenance. At the moment its running gear has to be fixed. Moreover, Sergyi would like to buy winter tires and an accumulator unit. That is why Sergyi is requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnas to fix the problem. One of his long-term plans is to continue improving living conditions of his family and provide for their basic needs. Sergyi is hoping to repay this loan in twelve months.

loans.use: To do car repairs

loans.name: Facundo

texts.es:
El señor Facundo S. vive en casa propia, en la zona  Pasankeri, ubicada en la ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa la señora Elsa Pérez y sus dos hijos.
El señor Facundo trabaja como albañil en obras de construcción particulares, su esposa se dedica a las labores de su hogar.
Su vivienda solo cuenta con dos habitaciones, por lo que el señor Facundo realizará la construcción de dos habitaciones que complementarán la vivienda y les dará mas espacio a sus hijos.
El crédito será para la construcción de la estructura para las dos habitaciones en planta baja.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Facundo S. lives in his own house in the Pasankeri neighborhood, which is located on the west side of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife, señora Elsa Pérez, and their two children. Facundo works as a construction worker, and his wife is a housewife. Their home only has two rooms, which is why Facundo will build two more rooms onto their house, which will give more space to their children. This credit will be used for the construction of the frame of two rooms on the ground floor. This is the fourth time that he is requesting a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis performed qualifies him favorably for access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of two rooms onto his house to give more comfort to his family

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.en:
Joséphine A. is the mother of six children, all of whom are now married. She does not know the date of her birth. Joséphine buys cookies in Nigeria cheaply, and then sells them in Dantokpa Market in central Cotonou. Five years ago another woman showed her how to buy goods in Nigeria, and she began making the trip a few hours east to buy in bulk. She estimates that she receives about 20 clients per day. In the current economic climate, her goals are modest, but she hopes to sell more cookies in the future.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates at seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

loans.use: Purchase of cookies

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy tiene 33 años, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos que están al cuidado de su madre que le apoya en casa. Hace 10 años se dedicaba a la venta de comida en el mercado, pero hace 6 tuvo la idea de alquilar un local donde brinda servicio de información turística a todos los visitantes que arriban a la ciudad de Tarma en fechas festivas como la Semana Santa, a Lucy le gusta mucho conversar con la gente e intercambia información, además aprovecha en vender sus platos de comidas típicas a todos los turistas. Esta actividad le es muy rentable, entonces está pensado buscar un lugar mucho más céntrico en la ciudad para tener más clientes.
