Este es su sexto préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, durante todo ese tiempo con la institución no ha tenido problemas de morosidad. El dinero lo invertirá en el pago del alquiler de su local por un mes, lo cual para ella es de mucha ayuda, y está muy agradecida por la facilidad de crédito que le dan.
texts.en:
Lucy is 33 years old, married and has two children who are cared for by her mother, who helps her at home. Ten years ago, Lucy was selling food in the market, but six years ago she had the idea of renting a locale to give tourist information to all visitors arriving in the city of Tarma on holidays such as Holy Week. Lucy very much enjoys talking with people and exchanging information, as well as offering to sell her regional dishes to all the tourists. The business is very profitable, and therefore she is thinking of finding a larger, more central, location in order to have more clients. This is her sixth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma: she has never had a late payment. She will invest the money to pay rent in her location for one month, which will be of great help to her, and she is very grateful to you for making this loan possible.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the rent for her business

loans.name: Alambi

texts.en:
E. is married with five children and lives in Ntamulung, a quarter in Bamenda, Cameroon. E. runs a small business in her house with her children. With this loan, she plans to buy more cassava, egusi, fowls and work more cassava farms.

This will be E.'s fifth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2000. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location (right on the main road), the quality of her products, and her reasonable prices. She buys in bulk, which causes the price to be minimal, and her children help her to process the cassava and produce water fufu. She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales.

The part of the profits from this loan will be used for the school fees of E.’s children, and the other part will be used for medication and food for for the family. E. does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments as they are quite small repayments every month. She intends to start repayment in the fourth month after taking the loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buy and sell cassava, egusi, fowls and farming of cassava

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 42 años D. edad, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos, actualmente está viviendo con dos D. ellos. DesD. muy joven le ha gustado realizar todo tipo D. costura, tuvo L. oportunidad D.  estudiar Corte y Confección D. ropa, esta actividad L. viene desarrollando desD. su casa, tiene a sus vecinos como clientes, quienes le mandan a coser una que otras prendas. Su esposo se dedica a L. compra y venta D. frutas y cuando él no está porque tiene que lleva sus productos, elL. se queda vendiendo las frutas. ElL. nos dice que no le agrada mucho el negocio D. las frutas porque se corre mucho riesgo en el transporte D. un lugar a otro, pero como todo matrimonio, se apoyan ambos en las actividades que realizan, el negocio D. su esposo es muy rentable, por ello que le apoya y sus ingreso en conjunto les permite llevar una vida muy cómoda. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprarán más frutas por camionadas directo D. las chacras, asimismo pagará L. confección D. los cajones para el transporte D. las  frutas.
texts.en:
Luz is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children, 2 of which she is currently living with. She has enjoyed sewing since she was very young. She had the opportunity to study dressmaking, which she does from home with her neighbours as her clients, who also refer her other clients. Her husband works buying and selling fruit and when he is not home because he needs to get more fruit, she stays to sell them. She tells us that she does not like this business very much because it is risky travelling from one place to another, but that as in any marriage, they support one another in their endeavours. Her husband's business is highly profitable, and so she supports him and the income it generates allows them to live very comfortably. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma; she has shown that she is punctual in her payments. She will use the loan to buy more fruit in bulk directly from the farms, as well as pay to make crates for the transport of the fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of fruit she can sell

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Jose B. tengo 30 años de edad y tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de confites los cuales distribuyo en pulperias y mercaditos, tambien los vendo de forma ambulante cuando termino de hacer el recorrido en las pulperias y mercaditos, en estos momentos necesito un credito para fortalecer mi negocio ya que tengo mayor demanda porque estoy empezando a vender en colegios y escuelas, de mi dependen mis hijos, estoy casado y gracias a Dios con mi esposa salimos adelante con los gastos de nuestro hogar.
texts.en:
Hi there! My name is Jose B.. I am 30 years old and I have a small business selling sweets which I distribute to grocery stores and small markets. I also sell the sweets in the street when I am finished delivering to the grocery stores and small markets. Right now I need a loan to bolster my business as I have more demand for my product as I am starting to sell in high schools and elementary schools. My children are depending on me: I am married and, thanks to God, my wife and I are able to pay our household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene 20 años, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos, por el momento está viviendo en la casa de su madre. Luego de terminar el colegio tenía la idea de estudiar una carrera técnica, por lo que había empezado a prepararse para su ingreso a un instituto, pero quedó embarazada, y estos planes se truncaron, tuvo que empezar a trabajar, y lo hizo mediante la venta ambulante de gelatinas en el campo deportivo frente a su casa, las ganancias le servían para cubrir los gastos de sus chequeos médicos, ahora ya tiene dos hijos y no sólo vende gelatina, sino que también prepara y vende refrescos de fruta, en adelante quiere comprar una parrilla para vender anticuchos por las noches, ya que la casa de su madre está en un lugar muy transitado. La venta de las gelatinas le está siendo rentable, sobre todo cuando hace calor. Su pareja trabaja con un motocarro realizando transporte de pasajeros. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, además paga sus cuotas en las fechas indicadas. Con el dinero solicitado, comprará la parrilla que necesita, además de utensilios para la preparación de anticuchos (brochetas).
texts.en:
Miriam is 20 years old, lives with her partner and has two children. Currently she is living in her mother´s house. After she finished high school she thought about studying for a technical degree and had started preparing for her entrance into an institute, but she became pregnant and those plans were cut short. She had to start working and did so by selling gelatin desserts at a playing field in front of her house. The earnings from this helped to cover the costs of her medical checkups. Now that she has two children, not only does she sell gelatin but she also prepares and sells fruit drinks. In the future she wants to buy a grill to sell anticuchos (a dish with small pieces of grilled skewered meat) at night since her mother´s house is in a very high-traffic area. The sale of gelatin has been profitable, most of all when the weather is hot. Her partner works with a 3 wheeled motor vehicle to transport passengers. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prismas and she makes her monthly payments on time. With the money she requests, she will buy the grill she needs as well as utensils to prepare the anticuchos.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a grill and utensils for cooking

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda tiene 19 años, es conviviente, tiene una sola hija, por el momento están viviendo en la casa de sus padres. Es de familia de agricultores, su esposo también es agricultor, entonces existen los mismos deseos de reprosperar en esta actividad, por ello han decidido sembrar varias hectáreas de papa y otras de arveja, porque para ellos la agricultura es muy rentable cuando se le dedica tiempo, eso aprendió de sus padres. Esta joven pareja tiene muchas esperanzas de prosperar en la agricultura para comprarse una casa en la ciudad, pero para conseguir eso, tienen que seguir sembrando papas, verduras y flores. Es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, Nilda es una pagadora puntual y responsable. En esta oportunidad solicita el dinero para mandar a labrar 2 hectáreas de sus tierras para la siembra de papa y olluco, y de ese modo generarse más ingresos económicos para el próximo año.
texts.en:
Nilda is 19 years old, lives with her partner and has just one daughter. Currently she is living in her parents´ house. She is from a family of farmers. Her husband is also a farmer so they have the same desire to succeed in this activity. They decided to plant several hectares with potatoes and peas because agriculture is very profitable for them when they devote time to it; they learned this from their parents. This young couple hopes to be successful in farming so they can buy a house in the city. But to achieve this they must keep planting potatoes, vegetables and flowers. This is her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. Nilda is a punctual and responsible payer. This time the loan she requests is to hire someone to work 2 hectares of her land to plant potatoes and olluco (a small, potato-like tuber), and in this way generate more earnings for the next year.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay workers to cultivate her fields.

loans.name: Rolin

texts.es: Rolin tiene 26 años, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos y está viviendo en la casa de su hermana mayor. Al igual que su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde muy niño, porque sus padres sembraban en grandes cantidades, y él está muy contento de ser agricultor, le agrada mucho, siguiendo el ejemplo de su hermana, siembra y luego él mismo o su esposa  llevan sus productos al mercado para comercializarlos, de ese modo, ya no dejan ganar a intermediarios con su esfuerzo. Para Rolin la agricultura le da buenas ganancias, nos dice, que sólo hay que saber atender la siembra en su momento, y estar pendiente de lo que necesita, de acuerdo a ello se le va medicando para tener una buena cosecha. Es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y es un cliente muy responsable en sus pagos. Su inversión, con este dinero que solicita, será para la compra de “Temex” insecticida que sirve para contrarrestar al gusano, cada bolsa de 5 kilos cuesta 250 soles.
texts.en:
Rolin is 26 years old, lives with his partner and has two children. He is living in his older sister´s house. Just like his family, he has been a farmer since he was a boy because his parents grew large amounts of crops. He is happy being a farmer, he likes it very much and, following the example of his sister, he plants and later he or his wife take the products to market to sell. This way he does not have to give away any of his efforts to middlemen. Farming gives Rolin good earnings. He tells us that you only need to know how to take care of what you plant and to pay attention to what the crops need. As such, he fertilizes so that he has a good harvest. This is his 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he is responsible with his payments. His investment with the money he is requesting will be to buy the insectide "Temex", which will help counteract worms; each 5-kilo bag costs 250 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy insecticides for his crops.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Estela S. soy una señora viuda y tengo 61 años de edad, vivo en la colonia 28 de marzo desde hace mas de 30 años, soy una persona luchadora, pero en estos momentos necesito un credito para poner mi negocio a funcionar, es mi primer credito que solicito.
En estos dias es muy dificil conseguir trabajos en empresas entonces lo que uno tiene que hacer es poner su propio negocio, yo me dedico a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas de Lunes a Sabado, ya que los Domingos me dedico a vender Sopa de Mondongo, este plato de comida es muy bien vendido en nuestra comunidad ya que es un plato muy exquisito y la gente lo compra mucho. 
tengo todos los deseos de superarme y por tal razon solicito este credito. gracias
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Estela S.. I am a widow, 61 years old, and I have lived in the 28 of March neighborhood for more than 30 years. I am a hard-working person, but today I need a loan to open my business, and this is the first loan I am seeking. Today it is very difficult to get work so what one has to do is open one’s own business. I make and sell tortillas Monday through Saturday, and on Sundays I sell Mondongo Soup. This food sells well in our community as it is a delicious dish and people buy it often. I have great desire to succeed and that is why I am asking for this loan. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lime, firewood, salt, water, vegetables, tripe, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es: Rosalbina tiene 47 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales viven con ella 2 de ellos. Hace 20 años, junto con su esposo, se dedicaban a la agricultura, pero al crecer sus hijos, se mudaron todos a la ciudad para que pudieran estudiar. Compraron su propio terreno y construyeron su casa después de mucho esfuerzo. Empezaron con la venta de verduras y frutas, pero poco a poco fueron creciendo y ahora tienen una bodega llamada “Rosa”. A Rosalbina le agrada el negocio, se distrae conversando con la gente y además le es muy rentable, hay días que vende cerveza, con esta bebida gana mucho más, por ello que prefiere invertir en cerveza. Su sueño es tener suficiente capital para convertir su bodega en un mini mercado, comenta sonriente. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado va comprar varios paquetes de gaseosas, y también cajas de cerveza, de ese modo estoquearse lo suficiente con estas bebidas, que son tan demandadas.
texts.en:
Rosalbina is 47 years old, married, with 4 children, 2 of whom still live at home. For 20 years, along with her husband, she has farmed. Upon raising her children, they moved to the city so the children could study. They bought their own plot of land and built their house with great effort. The began selling vegetables and fruit, but little by little they grew their business and now they have a convenience store called “Rosa.” Rosalbina enjoys the business, she talks with people and in addition it is very profitable. There are days that she sells beer, and with this beverage she earns much more, so that is why she prefers to invest in beer. Her dream is having sufficient capital to convert her convenience store into a mini market, she says smiling. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and has been punctual with her payments. With the money she is going to buy various packages of soda pop, and also cases of beer, in this way she will have enough stock to meet her customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beverates for her convenience store

loans.name: Shale

texts.es: Shale tiene 39 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos, viven con su madre que les ayuda en sus labores. Desde pequeña le ha prestado una profunda dedicación al cultivo de la tierra, además cría ganado y vacunos, se levanta a las 4.00am, prepara los desayunos y almuerzos, después de dar de comer a sus animales o de lo contrario los lleva al campo para pastear, regresa a preparar el almuerzo y lo lleva a la chacra donde su esposo con los peones trabajan. Cuando no es tiempo de cultivo o de cosecha sólo sale a pastar a sus animales. A ella le agrada la agricultura y ganadería, pero nos dice que la chacra es muy rentable cuando produce bien, y se recupera el doble de lo invertido, solo que la dificultad es el alto costo de los fertilizantes, ellos tenían previsto comprar 10 sacos, pero sólo podrán comprar 5. Este es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y es puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará fertilizantes y pesticidas para sus chacras de papa, y está muy agradecida por el dinero que le facilitarán, de ese modo podrá abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Shale is 39 years old, married, has 3 children, and they live with her mother who helps them with their work. Since she was little she has farmed, as well as raised cattle and sheep. She gets up at 4:00 AM, prepares breakfast and lunches, then feeds her animals or takes them to the field to graze. Then she returns to prepare lunch and takes it to the farm where her husband and laborers work. When it is not the season to farm or harvest she only goes out to graze her animals. She enjoys farming and raising livestock. She tells us that farming is very profitable when the harvest is good, and she then doubles her investment. What is difficult is the high cost of fertilizers, and they needed to buy 10 sacks but only could buy 5. This is her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is punctual with her payments. With the money she will buy fertilizers and pesticides for her potato plants, and she is very grateful for the money that will be provided and in this way be able to fertilize her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crops

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales viven con ella 2 de ellos. Hace 30 años que se dedicaba al cultivo de la tierra, ya que heredó varias chacras de su padre, pero lamentablemente para llegar no hay mucho acceso a la movilidad, entonces no puede sacar sus productos, y si paga por hacerlo, el costo del producto sube demasiado, entonces ella vio por conveniente comprar una casa en la ciudad, donde viven ella y sus hijos, mientras su esposo se quedó cuidando y cultivando las chacras. Susana empezó a dedicarse a la venta de comida a los chóferes de las minibases de transporte público que se estacionan en el paradero cerca de su domicilio, esta actividad, por el momento, le es muy rentable, ya que prepara cantidades medidas para que le sobre y pierda, además está contenta porque está viviendo y viendo estudiar a sus hijos. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfnanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado va acondicionar un lugar en su casa para vender la comida, de ese modo ya no tendrá que cargar ollas pesadas hacia la calle.
texts.en:
Susana is 49 years old, is married and has six children. Two live with her. She has been dedicated to farming for thirty years since she inherited various ranches from her father. Lamentably, to get there, there is little access so she cannot get her products out and if she pays to do so, the cost of her products will increase too much. Consequently, she saw buy a house in the city as desirable, where she lives now with her children while her husband remains taking care of and farming the ranches. Susana began to dedicate herself to selling food to public minibus drivers who are parked at the stop near her house. This activity, for the moment, is very profitable since she prepares measured quantities so there is little leftover and no waste. In addition, she is happy because she is living and seeing her children get an education. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting, she is going to air condition a place in her house so that she may sell food. In this manner, she will not have to carry heavy pots to the street.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Establish a space in her home from which to sell food.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 22 años, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres, juntamente con sus hermanos menores. De padres agricultores, y por supuesto heredó el trabajo con mucha entrega y dedicación a la tierra, está sembrando papa en grandes cantidades en la chacra de sus padres, además que les ayuda a ellos. En este año ha sembrado 6 hectáreas de papa, está muy contento porque le favoreció el mercado en el precio de su producto, comenta que en estos tiempos es bueno ser agricultor, pero es mucha inversión, y es esa la dificultad, cuando le falta dinero para comprar insecticidas y fertilizantes para que pueda producir como requiere el mercado. Este es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado va a comprar fertilizantes como el nitrato y potasio para que pueda abonar su chacra de papas, inclusive cree que la faltará algo de dinero para la compra de pesticidas.
texts.en:
Victor is 22 years old, single and lives at home with his parents, along with his younger brothers. Since his parents are farmers, he, of course, inherited a strong work ethic and dedication to the land. He is planting potato in great quantities on his parents' ranch, in addition to helping them. This year, he has planted six hectares of potato. He is happy because the market favors him with the price of his product. He comments that in these times, it is good to be a farmer. However, the investment is great and the difficulty is when he lacks money to buy insecticides and fertilizers so that he may produce as much as required for the market. This is his seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. In all this time, he has demonstrated that he is very punctual with his repayments. With the money he is requesting, he is going to buy fertilizer such as nitrates and potasium so that he can fertilize his potato ranch.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers for his potato farming.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 33 años, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos pequeños que por el momento  están viviendo en la casa de sus suegros. Cuando estaba soltera en la zona rural de la ciudad de Tarma trabajando en la chacra, desde que hizo familia se dedicó primero a vender papas en el mercado, pero esto le era muy trabajoso y no muy rentable, entonces cambió de rubro, ahora compra y vende ropa interior y calcetines, en el mercado donde vende encuentra mucha competencia, pero igual continúa y se esfuerza para crecer. Lo bueno es que cuando junta capital puede comprar grandes cantidades y eso le es más rentable y sobre todo a ella le gusta vender y estar en contacto con la gente. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, no ha tenido dificultades en sus pagos hasta el momento. Con el dinero solicitado va invertir en la compra de prendas en mayor cantidad, para fin de año piensa comprar ropa amarilla, debido a la tradición de usar una prenda de ese color para recibir el nuevo año.
texts.en:
Vilma is 33 years old. She lives with her partner and has three small children who, at the moment, are living at her mother- and father-in-law's house. When she was single, she worked on a ranch in the rural area of the city of Tarma. Since beginning a family, she first dedicated herself to selling potatoes in the market. However, this was very hard work and not very profitable so she changed her line of business. Now she buys and sells underwear and socks. In the market where she sells, there is a lot of competition but she continues anyways and she works hard to grow. What's good is when she has capital to be able to buy great quantities and this is more profitable. Above all, she enjoys sales and being in contact with people. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She has not had any difficulties with her payments preivously. With the money that she is requesting, she is going to invest in the purchase of garments in a greater quantity. For the end of the year, she's thinking of buying yellow clothing, due to the tradition of using a garment of this color to receive the new year.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for the New Year celebration.

loans.name: Miramesi 2 Group

texts.es: hola nosotros somos el grupo MIRAMESI 2, es nuestra primera solicitud de creditos, queremos salir adelante con nuestros negocios y estamos seguros que nos va a ir muy bien en nuestras actividades, nuestro grupo se conforma asi: Javier M. soy el coordinador del grupo, tengo 26 años de edad y me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, junto a mi tengo a Francisca Z. que tiene su negocio de venta de ropa clasificada ella tiene se negocio hace 2 años y tiene bastante demanda, y como tecer integrante del grupo esta la Sra Reina R. de 28 años de edad quien tambien se dedica a la venta de ropa clasificad, ella tiene su negocio hace 3 años, todos residimos y tenemos nuestros negocios en la colonia Miramesi, gracias a nuestros negocios podemos dar el sustento a nuestras familias. en estas epocas necesitamos capital para poder incrementar nuestros inventarios ya que las demandas de nuestros clientes son muchas, por tal razon necesitamos este credito. gracias
texts.en:
Hello. We are the MIWAMESI 2 group. This is our first request for a loan, and we want to be successful with our businesses and we are sure that our businesses will go well for us. Our group consists of: Javier M. – I’m the coordinator of the group, I’m 26 years old, and I sell groceries, along with me are Francisca Z. who has had a business selling clothing for 2 years and has a good customer base, and the third member is Mrs. Reina R. who is 28 years old who also sells clothing, and has been selling for 3 years. We all live and have our businesses in the Miramesi neighborhood. Thanks to our businesses we can support our families. AT this time we need capital to be able to increase our inventory as the demand from our clients is high, so we need this loan. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth H. is married to another Kiva borrower, Daniel Adanmitande. Elisabeth has been smoking fish since she helped her own mother with the business. Due to the lake’s pollution, some of the fish must be imported. She also sells palm oil and assorted foods. With this loan, she will buy palm oil in large quantities when the price is low from Dantokpa Market. Elisabeth has 4 children, all educated, ages 14, 11, 8, and 4 years old. She will be 50 years old in November, and this is her first Kiva loan.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates at seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

loans.use: Purchase of red palm oil

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
hola nosotros somos el grupo GENESIS estamos ubicados en el municipio de Danli, nosotros tenemos mucho tiempo de conocernos y siempre hemos trabajado juntos ya que somos vecinos, nuestro grupo esta solicitando un credito para adquirir materia prima y compra de mercaderia para la venta, este credito sera de mucha importancia para nosotros, nuestro grupo se forma de esta manera:
Santos Cristina L.: soy la coordinadora del grupo me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular y venta de repuestos de bicicletas, tengo 4 años de dedicarme a esta activiidad.
Santos Julian L.: el se dedica a la compra y venta de granos basicos desde hace 4 años, con los ingresos que el recibe de esta actividad le permiten cumplir con los gastos personales, el es un hombre soltero y con muchos deseos de superacion, el le apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.
Nohemi del Carmen R.: la actividad de ella es la venta de cosmeticos, con este negocio ella ayuda a su familia a salir adelante con los gastos del hogar.
todos necesitamos este credito para salir adelante, y como es espoca de navidad las ventas son buenas y por eso es que necesitamos comprar mas producto para poder cubrir con las necesidades de todos nuestros clientes.
texts.en:
Hi, we are the GENESIS group, located in the town of Danli. We've had a lot of time to get to know each other and we've always worked together because we're neighbors. Our group is asking for a loan to acquire raw materials and commodities to sell. This loan is very important to us. Our group is organized as follows:

Santos Cristina L.: I am the coordinator of the group. I sell popular consumer goods and bicycle parts, and have done so for four years.

Santos Julian L.: He has bought and sold basic grains for the past four years, and he uses his earnings to cover his personal expenses. He is a single man with many aspirations, who helps his parents with their household expenses.

Nohemi del Carmen R.: She sells cosmetics, and with this business helps her family pay off their household expenses.

We all need this loan to succeed. With the Christmas season upon us, sales are good and we need to buy more products to meet all our customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase commodities

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: El señor Jesús P. tiene más de 12 años  dedicándose a su negocio, la venta es especialmente de accesorios para celulares y artículos personales. Desea incrementar la variedad de productos para esta temporada, se encuentra instalado a las afueras de una clínica del gobierno,  esto le beneficia en sus ventas pues la cantidad de gente que transita por ese sector es sorprendente, Él les agradecerá infinitamente su contribución para agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jesús P. has more than 12 years' experience in his business: the sale of accessories for cell phones and personal articles. He would like to increase the variety of products he can offer for this season. He is located near a government clinic, which benefits his sales due to the surprisingly high number of passersby. He thanks you infinitely for your help in improving his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for his business

loans.name: Lisseth Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Lissette P. es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega dedicándose a su actividad de producción de miel ya que ella se ha dedicado a la actividad apícola en este municipio.

Por ser una dama muy inteligente ha logrado salir adelante manteniendo a su familia y brindándole las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Hoy en día ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de cajas donde lleva a cabo esta actividad. Es por este motivo que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando la aprobación de un crédito para así comprar dichas cajas y seguir produciendo la miel de las abejas en su municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Lissette P. is originally from the city of Chinandega, and dedicates herself to honey production as she is a beekeeper in this municipality. Because she is a very smart woman, she has managed to get her family ahead and provide for all their necessities. Today, she is asking for a loan to buy cases to carry out her beekeeping activities. She approached Ceprodel hoping to be approved for a loan to buy the cases and continue producing honey from bees in El Viejo in the city of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases for her beekeeping business

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
En el Mercado Iván Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua el señor Iván A. se dedica a laborar arduamente en su negocio de venta de queso el cual comercializa muy esforzadamente desde hace varios años.

Anteriormente él había tenido créditos con Ceprodel el cual le habían ayudado grandemente porque había adquirido los productos lácteos. Hoy en día una vez más ha solicitado créditos para la compra de los productos lácteos y espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con su negocio en el mercado Iván Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua.
texts.en:
Iván A. works hard at his cheese-selling business in the Iván Montenegro market in Managua. He has worked hard at this business for several years. He has had previous loans from Ceprodel which have helped him greatly, in allowing him to buy milk products. Today, once again, he is asking for a loan to buy milk products and he is hoping that his loan will be approved so that he can continue his business in the Iván Montenegro market in the city of Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for cheese making

loans.name: Veronica J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Veronica Millinga from Kyela. She is married with 2 children, aged 11 and 13. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependants because their parents cannot take care of them.

Veronica has been running a crops selling business since 2004. She buys crops from farmers and bring them to town where she can sell them at higher price. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by three family members.

Veronica currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to purchase 50 bags of rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. Veronica thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Teresa A. G. tengo 35 años de edad y vivo en el barrio el chile de esta ciudad, es primera vez que solicito un credito, este mismo lo necesito para poder comprar mas lacteos ya que no cubro con las exigencias de mis clientes y mi producto se me termina rapido, los lacteos son mi actividad principal pero tambein vendo huevos y carnes, estos productos se venden pero con menor porcentaje, soy una persona luchadora y deseo salir adelante con mi negocio que es mi unica fuente de ingresos, con este negocio estoy sacando adelante a mis hijos. muchas gracias
texts.en:
Hi! My name is Teresa A. G.; I am 35 years old and I live in the "el chile" neighbourhood of this city. This is the first time that I have asked for a loan. I need the loan to buy more milk as I am not able to keep up with demand from my customers and my stock is running out. My main business is selling milk, but I also sell eggs and meat in smaller quantities. I am a fighter and I want to get ahead with my business as it is my only source of income. This business allows me to take care of my children. Thank you very much!

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Kossi H. is a 36-year-old married father. In the local language, Ewe, his first name indicates that he was born on Sunday. Kossi lives in the village of Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. To provide for his family, Kossi sells ‘sandelettes,’or flip-flops, in a small boutique located in the central market in Wome. These comfortable and inexpensive shoes are very popular among Togolese in this region and are always in demand.

Kossi hopes to use the money from this loan from FECECAV to make his shop look more professional through the creation of a display for his flip-flops. He hopes to attract more customers and compete with other vendors. With the profits from his business he will be able to continue to support his children and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To make his shop look more professional

loans.name: Doris Zulema

texts.es:
Doris es una joven emprendedora que trabaja como socia de su padre en una imprenta donde realiza impresiones de recibos y facturas, los cuales ella  comercializa en los puestos de ventas de la Ciudad de La Paz; también estudia en la universidad publica UMSA. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (papel y copias) por cantidad y así logrará bajar sus costos de producción.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar otro préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Doris is an enterprising young woman who works as a partner of her father in a print shop where he prints receipts and invoices, which she sells to businesses in Ciudad de La Paz. She also studies at the public university UMSA. She lives in her parents' house located in Villa Adela in the city of El Alto. She will use the loan to buy raw materials (paper and copy paper) in bulk and in this manner lower her production costs. This is her second loan with Impro; her good repayment history allows us to approve this new loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Don Samuel tiene ya mas de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de jugos y licuados, su objetivo es poner una sucursal en la cual tenga otras opciones, como lonches, alimentos rápidos, etc. 
Con dos créditos anteriores de FVP le ha invertido a su negocio y sus frutos son muy buenos. 
El negocio lo trabajan él y su esposa Liliana.
texts.en:
Samuel has sold juices and smoothies for more than four years. His goal is to expand in order to offer more, such as lunches, fast foods, etc. He has invested his two previous loans with FVP in his business and the results have been good. He and his wife Liliana work in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To diversify his business

loans.name: Sumacc Suncco Group

texts.en:
The Sumacc Soncco Village Bank group members live in the Escalera community of Huando District, in Huancavelica Department. The community is small, but very charming. The main economic activities in the area are agriculture and livestock, and each day the men and women of the community go to out together to work on their farms; they plant and harvest crops seasonally.

Adriana D. L. C. is married with four children. She sells chickens and guinea pigs (a Peruvian delicacy), and recently began bringing skinned guinea pigs to Lima and Huancayo to sell for meat. She will use her loan to buy a bull to help her plough, a task she used to do herself with hand tools. Now she has one bull, which saves her a lot of time, so she plans to buy another one. Her dream is for her children to follow a good path and for them to learn to read, a skill Adriana never learned herself. She wants her children to graduate from college with professional degrees, and hopes that her business will become more profitable.

Marina R. is married and has two children. She sells small numbers of animals like pigs, sheep and cows (she does not sell in bulk). She sells the meat from door to door for a good price. With her loan, she will buy a bull to rent out for the Running of the Bulls, which is held each June in Huancavelica. Her dream is to have her own chicken farm.

Flora G. is married and has five children. She sells potatoes seasonally in local markets, and also sells prepared meals in different local markets; on Wednesdays she works in Izucuchaca and on Saturdays in Acostambo. Flora is very cheerful; she likes to sing and organize group activities for her village bank during meetings. She plans to use her loan to buy guinea pigs to sell for the Christmas season. Her dream is to have her own guinea pig farm.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow El Bancomunal Sumacc Soncco, esta ubicado en L. comunidad D. Escalera, en el distrito D. Huando en L. Provincia y departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad es pequeña pero muy acogedora. Su actividad principal es L. agricultura-ganadería día a día las mujeres y varones van al campo a realizar faenas comunales, siembran y cosechan por temporadas. Adriana D. L. C., es casada, tiene 4 hijos, se dedica a L. venta D. gallinas, cuys, aprendió a llevar a Lima y Huancayo cuys pelados, con su préstamo comprará un toro para el arado, antes solía limpiar con sus chakitacllas y a mano, ahora le ahorra tiempo un toro y se comprará otro. Su sueño es que sus hijos sigan un camino bueno que no sean analfabetos como elL., que sean profesionales y su negocio prospere mas. Marina Ramírez, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a L. venta D. animales como cerdos, ovino vacuno en pequeña cantidad, no al por mayor, ofrece las carnes D. casa en casa a precio cómodo. Con su préstamo quiere comprar un toro para alquilar en las corridas D. toros D. Huancavelica en el mes D. junio. Su sueño es tener una granja D. pollos. Flora G., es casada, tiene 5 hijos, se dedica a L. venta D. papa por temporadas en las ferias, venD. comida también los miércoles en Izcuchaca y en Acostambo los sábados, así trabaja D. feria en feria. Flora es muy alegre, le gusta cantar y organizar las actividades en las reuniones D. su bancomunal, su préstamo lo usará en comprar cuys para llevar en las navidades. Su sueño es tener una granja D. cuys.

loans.use: Bbuy a bull to help her plough

loans.name: Bernabé

texts.es:
El señor Bernabé H. tiene tres hijos que a los cuales les quiere dar la mejor educación, para esto su esposa lo apoya incondicionalmente para lograr sus objetivos.
Su lugar de trabajo es un punto público de la ciudad, él presta el servicio de polarizado de autos, a pesar de esto su estancia es permanente y con los 16 años de experiencia su clientela se asegura de buenos resultados, tambien acude a los domicilios cuando se lo solicitan para polarizar los ventanales y las puertas de las oficinas.
Desea comprar material por mayoreo, para esto necesita contar con un buen capital para realizar sus compras en la Cd. de Monterrey, esta operación le mantendrá abastecido por un largo periodo y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Bernabé H. has three children to whom he wants to give the best possible education. His wife supports him unconditionally in this goal. Bernabé provides window tinting services for cars. His workplace is on public property in the city, in spite of this it is a permanent location and with his 16 years of experience, his customers can be assured of good results. He also provides his window tinting services at people's homes, to tint their windows or doors. He wants to buy materials wholesale. For this, he needs working capital to buy in the city of Monterrey. This will keep him stocked for a long time and in so doing he can make greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material
